67001.description:
Erin Morai, a troubled but dedicated biology student, found herself strangely attracted to Tyler Scindere... which is why she agreed to follow him in the first place. Now, lured into darkness, will she retain her composure, and her very sanity, long enough to save herself?

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of the second Asylum Pack in The Yuggoth Contract cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game!

Murmurs of Evil is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

Also included in this cycle is part two of a gripping new short story by Nate French. In the last installment, Tyler Scindere found himself trapped in perpetual darkness and suffering. Now, we meet Erin Morai, a brilliant college student. Erin might be Tyler’s greatest enemy... and his only hope.
67001.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Murmurs of Evil Asylum Pack
boardgameexpansion: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
Call of Cthulhu: The Yuggoth Contract

67002.name: Esians
67002.description:
Bad days have come... New perils arise where the Evil was uprooted, and the world of Esians is becoming dark and savage once again. Only fortitude and courage can turn the tide to bring back the good times of old.
Do you dare to explore the unknown regions? Will you brave the ever-present dangers - and survive?

Esians is a small and portable card game of fantasy adventures, designed primarily as a solitaire, but it can accomodate up to three players in either cooperative or competitive mode. On their journey through the lands of Esians players seek out adventures, encouter friends and foes (the latter being more the case) and reap rewards or recieve punishment.

67005.name: Deluxe Edition
67005.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fat Dragon Games is proud to present E-Z DUNGEONS: Deluxe Edition, the all new successor to our award winning E-Z Dungeons: Basic Set. This new model set features richly detailed graphics, new items, new layout and attachment techniques, and even more builder-friendly assembly designs. This set utilizes our all new 'E-Z Layout' designs, allowing you to layout dungeons on-the-fly during your game quickly and easily. These new subassembly designs allow you to make virtually any dungeon from a handful of basic shapes. New wall and corridor options give you greater design flexibility, and our new attachment techniques make securing your dungeon design a snap. We have included multiple versions of some models for multiple skill levels, such as our pre-printed doors for beginners and more complex opening versions featuring our exclusive 'E-Z Hinge' design for advanced modelers.
This PDF includes:
•New wall and corridor tiles
•Bonus Hexagon Tile
•Archway with 'E-Z Hinge' door (2", 3" and 4" wide versions)
•Archway with 'E-Z Hinge' double doors
•Archway with optional pre-printed easy-build doors (2" and 4" wide versions)
•Wood and Metal 'E-Z Hinge' doors (both single and double door designs)
•Faceted curved hallway
•Predesigned E-Z Layout tile designs for common room and hall layouts
•Cross Hall Intersection
•L Hall Intersection (1", 2" and 4" versions)
•T Hall Intersection
•Pillars (2", 3" and broken designs)
•Square pillar
•Stairs (1" wide and 'hall width')
•Broken dungeon wall (2 designs)
•Dungeon walls, clean and weathered versions (1", 2", 3", 4", 6" & 8" lengths)
•Angled dungeon wall (45 degree)
•Dungeon wall endcap filler pieces (2 versions)
•Wooden barrels
•Wooden tables
•Wooden crates (2 sizes)
•3D rubble model
•3D 'drop in' secret door
•Tilting floor trap
•Torch sconce
•Floor trapper creature
•Treasure chests (2 styles)
•3D treasure pile
•Weapons rack
•Dungeon well
•Two different options for linking walls
•All new E-Z Layout designs
•Full color beginners guide to card modeling

67006.name: Rhinopedia
67006.description:
A roll and move game based on trivia answers to questions about rhinoceroses. Sort of like Trivial Pursuit - if every topic was rhinoceros.

From the box:

"The rhinos are stampeding! Be the first rhino to reach home by your superior rhinowledge."

67007.name: Limn
67007.description:
Limn is a balderdash style party game for four to ten players.

Each player gets a few pages from newspapers and/or magazines and clips words or phrases that could describe each one of the other players from these papers. When everyone has chosen phrases for all the players, the clippings are randomized and the players guess who clipped the phrases and who is being described. Players score points for correct guesses.

67009.name: Horde Runners
67009.description:
From the online rule page:
Two opposing forces wage a war of the minds as the attempt to steal the "horde" of the other team. Each side has four "thieves" that are attempting to retrieve the treasure of the other team.

Find rules at: http://www.icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Horde_Runn...

This Icehouse game requires four Icehouse sets, a chess board and one die. This capture the flag style game for two players has players trying to sneak treasures out of their opponent's stockpiles. The first player to bring three pieces of treasure back to the home base is the winner!

rpgpodcastepisode: NvP 5x04 - Castle Ravenloft & Red Box with Mike Mearls
RPG Circus Season 2 Episode 3 - Everything You Need Is In The Box
67011.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The best way to start playing the 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

Designed for 1–5 players, this boxed game contains everything needed to start playing the Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game, including rules for creating heroes, advice for playing the Dungeon Master, a solo play adventure, and group-play adventure content. Learning the game has never been so easy!

Several different character races (dwarf, elf, halfling, and human) and classes (cleric, fighter, rogue, and wizard) are presented, along with powers for each race and class.

Game components:


32-page book for players, with rules for character creation and a solo adventure
64-page book for Dungeon Masters, with the rules of the game, advice on how to run the game, and adventure content
1 sheet of die-cut tokens for characters and monsters
Cardstock character sheets and power cards
Double-sided dungeon map
6 polyhedral dice

67012.name: We All Scream for Ice Cream
67012.description: Kid's game recommended for ages 5 to 10 years. Can be played by 2 or more players. Play individually, or in teams. Spin the spinner to see how many ice cream scoops you need to place on your cone, and to find out if you get to stand on two feet, or have to balance on just one. The first player or team to stack 7 scoops without dropping any of them wins.

67013.name: Because It's There!
67013.description:
This game is FREE Print And Play.

From the web page:

Because It's There is not really a war game, but it is a conflict simulation in which man challenges nature in an attempt to be the first to scale the world's highest mountain peak. This is a solitaire game in which the player assumes the role of the leader of an expedition on Mount Everest. Cards represent actual climbers from the ill-fated 1924 British expedition, the successful 1953 British expedition, and the first successful American expedition of 1963.

67015.name: Game of Inventions
67015.description: The purpose of the game is to educate players about the most up to date inventions (of the time) and their inventors. Up to 10 can play. Each player gets a card with 5 inventors listed on it. There is a pile of cards with inventions listed on them, and the goal of the game is to claim inventions that belong to the inventors shown on your card. The winner is the one who first completes his card correctly.

67016.name: 101 Starship Names
67016.description:
From the introduction:

A list is intended to be a generic starting point in coming up with starship names suitable for most settings.

67018.description:
from poeppelkiste.de:

One player uses magnetic force & an ornery witches broom to move his magic crystals across the board and into the cauldron. At the same time, another player rolls dice as the Guardian of Time in order to stop the player turn. Whoever gets four crystals in first wins the game.

from HABA website:
All the witches have gathered for the duel with the jinxed broom Mumbo Jumbo. Each one tries to tame the flying broom and make it sweep their magic gems into the cauldron. However, only the one who has a magic touch with the witch's magnetic power will be the first to be able to sweep his magic gems into the cauldron.
67018.name: Hexenduell

67019.name: Rules Compendium
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best Rules - Silver Winner
67019.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A quick and handy rules reference and guide for the Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

This handy and comprehensive Dungeons & Dragons book is intended as a quick rules reference. It contains the complete core rules for the 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

In addition to providing an overview of the game and how it’s played, this book presents the core rules in a format that is easily referenced during a game. It includes information on level advancement, combat, experience points, treasure, skills, equipment, and more.

67020.name: Dungeon Master's Kit
67020.description:
From the publisher:

Awesome tools, rules, and adventure content for every Dungeon Master.

If you’re a Dungeons & Dragons player interested in taking on the role of the Dungeon Master, or if you’re an experienced DM looking for more game advice, tools, and adventure content, the Dungeon Master’s Kit has exactly what you need to build your own Dungeons & Dragons campaign and excite the imaginations of you and your players.

This deluxe box contains rules and advice to help Dungeon Masters run games for adventurers of levels 1–30. It also includes useful DM tools such as a Dungeon Master’s screen (with tables and rules printed on the inside), die-cut terrain tiles and monster tokens, and fold-out battle maps.

Game components:


256-page book of rules and advice for Dungeon Masters
Two 32-page adventures
2 sheets of die-cut monster tokens
2 double-sided battle maps
Fold-out Dungeon Master’s screen

67021.name: Player Essentials: Heroes of the Fallen Lands
67021.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Exciting new builds and character options for the cleric, fighter, ranger, rogue, and wizard classes.

This essential player product for the 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game presents exciting new builds for the most iconic classes: the cleric, the fighter, the rogue, and the wizard. Each class comes with a set of new powers, class features, paragon paths, epic destinies, and more that beginning players can use to build the characters they want to play and experienced players can plunder for existing 4th Edition characters.

In addition to new builds, this book presents expanded information and racial traits for some of the game’s most popular races, including dwarves, eladrin, elves, halflings, and humans.

67022.description:
The Official Italian National Championship deluxe edition of Risiko, the Italian edition of Risk.

During the years, Risiko has radically changed with the development of new rules specifically designed for the tournaments. A special set of secret objects, the time limit and the original scoring system (not to mention the popular "tanks" a sort of Risiko's icon in Italy) are peculiar features of the Italian way of playing this game. This brand new box is the final result of a development that started in the first half of the '90s and ended with Risiko Digital, the online version of the game. "Chellenge" is the title of the most important online tournament that is part of the selections for the annual Italian National Risiko Championship. This new box is specifically dedicated to all the "Challenge players".

The box incldues the official tournament rules, top level components and a new game variant called "Kingmaker".
67022.name: RisiKo! Challenge
boardgamefamily: RisiKo!: Risk variations by Spartaco Albertarelli

67024.name: The Wholey Book of Clichés and Cabbages
67024.description:
From the game's introduction:

Discordia is a loose disorganization of Eris Freaks. A better definition is impossible. If you are unfamiliar with Discordia, please read The Principia Discordia before attempting to embark upon these misadventures. Other possible sources for information regarding Discordianism itself are listed in Appendectomy A at the bottom of this file.

If, on the other hand, you are reading this because you are a Discordian and are unfamiliar with RISUS, please visit the RISUS Website at Cumberland Games: http://www222.pair.com/sjohn/risus.htm or read Appendectomy B: Our Summary of Risus before continuing.

YOU CALL THESE RULES?

All rules in this supplement (and in reality, for that matter) are subject to change by any Meta-Technician.

All rules remain as outlined in RISUS, with the following changes:


All known "Optional Rules" for Risus are fully available BUT keep in mind that RISUS is a very simplified system for a reason - to cut out all of the tracking and rolling that inhibits roll-playing. On one level this is good - it frees the characters and GM to do what they want and not have to keep track of things and roll dice every time something comes up. On the other hand, Discordians sometimes find enjoyment in complexity. Pick and choose the optional rules that work for your group (or mood). It is not out of the question for some people in the group to play with optional rules in effect while others do not.



All known rules ever introduced to the game by Meta-Technicians are still in effect.



Players should attempt to choose clichés that they will be able to roleplay. For example, if you are unfamiliar with Conspiracy Theories, you should not choose "Paranoid" as a cliché, or it you do, research it a bit in real life.



Every player automatically gets the cliché "Pope" (since every man, woman and child is a Pope). A Pope’s chief weapon is surprise... Surprise and fear... fear and surprise... Their two weapons are fear and surprise... and ruthless efficiency... Their three weapons are fear, and surprise, and ruthless efficiency... and an almost fanatical devotion to Eris... Their four... no... Amongst their weapons... Hmf... Amongst their weaponry... are such elements as fear, surprise... and nice red uniforms. Well, you get the general idea.



Optional Rules specific to this Discordian Supplement may be found in Appendectomy C: Optional Rules.

67026.description:
Be the first person to build a castle in one's own color.

All the cards are placed face down in the center of the table. In each turn the players must always take at least one card from the top of this draw pile.

If a player picks up a 'castle' card, she places it in front of her, marking the beginning of a castle in the color of that particular card. If another player is already building a castle in that color, the player must place the card face up on her right-hand side. These cards can be discarded or sold later in the game. After having picked up a castle card, the player may take yet another card from the pile, or pass her turn.

If a player picks up a 'fairy' or a 'diamond' card, it also has to be placed face up on the player's right-hand side. As with a castle card another card may be taken from the pile after having picked up a fairy card, or the turn may be passed.

Diamond cards can be used to buy castle cards from other players. 3 diamond cards can be exchanged for a single castle card. A player may not refuse to sell a castle card. Furthermore, only a single castle card can be bought in a turn. A player is not allowed to take a card from the pile in the same turn in which she buys a castle card from an opponent.

If a player picks up a 'witch' card it's bad luck! Then a player must place the witch card, and 3 other cards next to the pile of cards in the center of the table and pass her turn. The 3 other cards can be diamond cards or castle cards, either from the player's right-hand side pile or from her own castle. If a player has less then 3 cards, she must hand in whatever cards she has.
A fairy card can be used to counter the witch card. If countered, both the witch card and the fairy card must be placed on the pile next to the cards in the center of the table.

Whenever there are no more cards left in the pile, all the cards that are next to the pile are taken, shuffled and placed back in the center of the table to form a new draw pile.

The player who manages to build her own castle completely (6 cards of the same color) wins the game.
67026.name: Diamoniak

67028.name: KORE RPG Guidelines
67028.description:
The KORE RPG is a universal system that can be used to create games in any genre. From the book:

The KORE Guidelines are a complete set of Role-playing rules that can be used to imagine any world and play any genre of game. The flexibility of the rule-set was paramount in the creation of the guidelines. At each point, I continually asked myself if the game required this rule to be present or if it could be eliminated. Some of the rules that were not necessary for the set to feel complete, but were elegant and loved by play testers, were allowed to remain under the optional category.

boardgameissuearticle: Lying in Wait in Front of the Finishing Line
Velo City: Other Winning Condition and Drug Test
67034.description:
A tactical dice game. Each player manages a team of bicycle messengers and tries to get as many of his own riders as possible to the goal.

When rolling a die to move one of your messengers you can land on three different types of fields on the board:
- most fields have no special effect
- some give an energy boost (a vitamin drink)
- some are obstacles which require you to use a vitamin drink, or slow you down.

Vitamin drinks can be played for other benefits in the game.

Instead of selecting a single messenger, one can also roll multiple dice for an entire group of riders. This allows a player to choose the most beneficial result, but in turn means that opponents' riders will also move.

The game ends as soon as all 3 messengers on a team reach the goal or eight total messengers have reached the goal. The team that has the most messengers at the goal wins. In the case of a tie, the player whose messenger crossed last wins. This is important, since during the end phase players may hold back messengers to avoid reaching the goal too soon.
67034.name: VeloCity

67035.name: Mekawing
67035.description:
1.9.5 print & play version available in spanish and english:
Spanish Version: https://goo.gl/YO4Dov
English Version: https://goo.gl/9LrSzM

It's been centuries since Humanity left the Earth after exhausting all its natural resources. Escaping to the stars was Humanity's solution, settling in space colonies all around the Solar System. Under the banner of Corpnations, the new post-Humanity has forgotten almost everything form its time on Earth, only having to turn back as a strange energy grows in their old home planet...

Mekawing is a Mecha Tactical Board Game in which two opposing wings battle each other in different scenarios.

Providing a total Cinematic Experience, Mekawing mixes the detail of miniature gaming, and the action/counter-action of card gaming to create a unique gaming experience. This is done with both wing creation and deck construction rules and mechanics.

Each player picks their Ace pilots which provide Wing Points from which they buy mechs - Mekas - for their wings. Players have three factions to play, each faction providing a selection of meka types and equipment configurations; focusing on melee combat, ranged combat, or special support.

Additionally, each player builds his/her own Duel decks with cards that show each meka's fighting style, and Upgrade cards that grant special actions and abilities to their Mekas, provide bonuses and/or create special battle situations; giving each wing its own tactics and strategies.

During play, players choose a scenario, build the map using terrain tiles, and use their mekas to gain control of the battleground using their meka's equipment and Action Cards.

Want to now the story behind Mekawing? go to https://mekawing.wordpress.com/2015/04/28/ficcion-mekawing-r... (content in spanish).

67036.name: Berlin XVIII (Second Edition)
rpgissuearticle: Aide de Jeu: les prégénériques en 9 questions
67036.description:
User Summary:

The second edition of Berlin XVIII features streamlined rules and expanded background.

What you get in the book:

- the new rules, covering everything needed to play (character creation, combat, car chases...)

- 26 pages of background, describing the world in 2066, the Berlin megapole, organized crime, the day-to-day life of a law enforcement agent in Berlin Sektor 18, available gear, police procedures...

- 2 scenarios ("Auslander" and "Demain petit, tu verras..."). Auslander is the first edition introduction scenario; the second one has the players try to figure out why several of their colleagues have succombed fits of homicidal rage.

67037.description:
From the back of the box:

Once every hundred years rare lucky crystals grow overnight in the valley of the goblins! However, only Wutzel, Wanda, Wimmel and Wommel know the way to the crystal treasure. But the little goblins are invisible. You can see them with the help of the big magic crystal! However, they will only show the way to the lucky crystals to those who call them by their proper names.

Goblins Treasure - the goblins memory game with the unique magic crystal.

Players discover a rare crystal treasure in the valley of the goblins. Sixteen valuable lucky crystals are hidden all over the board and guarded by invisible goblins. A big magic crystal with a magnetic pendulum inside helps players identify the hidden goblins. Only correctly identified goblins will guide a player towards the hidden lucky crystals.
67037.name: Schatz der Kobolde

67038.description:
The game comes with:
- Plastic honey drops of which each players gets 15 at the beginning of the game
- Cards with one or more animals (dogs, monkeys, rabbits, mice and pigs)
- Cards with the animals favourite food on them

Except for the pigs, all animals are quite choosy and will only eat their favourite food. Pigs can be used to steal opponents food.

Game-play has two phases: First, each player is dealt some random animal cards and tries to optimize his hand by discarding and drawing new cards. Then each player must feed all his animals. If a player doesn't have enough food, he has to substitute honey drops to console his animals. The game ends when there's no food left. Whoever has the most honey drops left wins.
67038.name: Charly

Strange Bedfellows - An adventure for West End Games' Star Wars the Role-playing Game
Walking on the Cybernetic Edge - Role-playing in the cyberpunk world




Gamemaster's Workshop

Close Encounters of the Random Kind - Random encounter tables suitable for any system
Shadis Realty Company - Generic maps and floorplans ready to occupy
Hook, Line and Sinker - Adventures on the Fly
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Generic non-player characters ready for action.

Bright Future - The plot thickens
Finieous Fingers - The world's greatest thief returns
Joe Genero - This Issue: Joe runs away!
Knights of the Dinner Table - The boys are at it again

67043.name: Dobbelsteen Spelletjes
67043.description:
On the cover:
Dobbelsteen Spelletjes including instructions for 26 different dice games.

Included are instructions for different dice games with 1,2,3,5 and 6 dice, a dice cup and 6 dice.

Games with 1 die: Jule, To and From, Add and Subtract, 21st One, Fifteen, The Big Heart, Game of Sixes

Games with 2 dice: Heaven and Eart, The Happy 7, The crossed 12, Eleven, Dice Game

Games with 3 dice: Blue Eyes, Chicago, Chicago High-Low, Succession, Double, Double Lotje, Game of tens, Two is One, From 1 till 16

Games with 5 dice: Big Bank, Dice Poker

Games with 6 dice: Three times a pair, The angry 7, Ohio

67045.name: Encounters: Sci-Fi Scenarios
67045.description:
User Summary:

"Encounters: Sci-Fi Scenarios" provides referees with guidelines for planning adventures and running exciting encounters for their favorite sci-fi role-playing games. Sections offer valuable advice for developing a consistent campaign setting, where NPCs have realistic motives and character actions make a difference. Straightforward tables allow you to quickly generate interstellar travel encounters and mishaps, location-specific encounters, mission complications, and encounters that stem from from the players' actions.

Entries provide the level of detail you want, ranging from "just the facts" to specific events with twists that encourage character development and reward role playing. One section generates events specifically for characters that get separated (or wander off) from the group. Also included are new starship designs and additional background material for the Era Ten campaign setting. This book is written for use with Era Ten, but is easily adaptable to any science fiction role-playing game.

"Encounters: Sci-Fi Scenarios" uses a pair of 8-sided dice and a standard deck of playing cards (not included).

67046.name: Fantastic Four: Fantastic Voyages
67046.description:
From the Back Cover:

Fantastic Adventures featuring your Favourite Heroes from the Epic Fantastic Four Roster Book!

Including:
The Sinister Skrulls!
Galactus, the Devourer of Worlds!
The Diabolical Diablo!
and the FF's Most Infamous Foe Doctor Doom!

67048.name: Troll
67048.description:
Troll is a two player game played on an empty 8x8 square board.
Each player owns two opposite edges.
Each player drops one of his stones on an empty cell.
If at least one opponent stone is between that stone and another friendly stone,then all opponent stones that were between those stones flip its color.
Wins the player who managers to do a path connecting his two opposite edges.

67051.description:
From the publisher (Fantasy Flight Games):

Legends say all magic in the land comes from an enchanted stream that flows from the tallest mountain. Atop the tallest peaks, the magical waters are at their most pure and potent, and the banks are littered with precious gems. But one must beware, for within the Highland dwells the feared Eagle King, guardian of the source of magic. Intruders and fortune-seekers will receive no mercy, for he has not forgotten that jewels stolen from him now adorn the Crown of Command itself!

Talisman: The Highland adds a new Region to the game for heroes to explore. A custom-fitted map board and over 100 new cards bring this mountainous realm vividly to life, while six brand-new characters, each represented with a superbly detailed plastic miniature, offer fantastic new playing experiences. Climb as high as you dare, and lay claim to the unimaginable wealth that awaits atop the tallest peak in the world of Talisman!
67051.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Highland Expansion

67052.name: Zombie Chess
67052.description:
User Summary:

Zombie Chess (A.K.A. The Case Against Humanity Winning the Zombie War) is a chess variant in which one player's chess pieces are replaced by plastic zombies. It will be the task of the "humans" to eliminate the zombie threat, which in itself is not a terrible task, but is made more complicated by the fact that, while battling the zombies, the "humans" can become infected, and also that the zombie ranks tend to replenish.

67053.name: Marxmen 12.35
67053.description:
User Summary:

Marxmen 12.35 is the only sourcebook released for Berlin XVIII second edition. Inside, you'll find:

- a chronology of events happening between 2066 and 2089

- a description of Australis, the Australian mining space station

- 2 scenarios ("Bonnes bavures & modes majeurs" and "Psychose")

- new rules for weapons and vehicles

- new weapons, cars, trucks...

- several short stories and a 5-pages comic

67054.description:
Fantasy Flight Games has made a couple of bonus Alternative Endings available via the Talisman Support Pages.

Alternative Endings were introduced in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Frostmarch Expansion and will no doubt feature more as new expansions are released.

The Crown of Command Ending is a copy of the original game ending, for those who would like to include it if randomly choosing an Ending.

Of course, you will require the card back which is also available on the Talisman Support Page!
67054.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Crown of Command

67055.description:
Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise (The Corn Circles), the seventh official mini-expansion for Carcassonne, consists of six tiles depicting corn circles made from corn stalks. A corn circle tile allows a player to place a second follower on a feature that they have already-claimed or return an already-placed follower back to his supply.

Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise first appeared in Germany as a bonus expansion shrinkwrapped to the Carcassonne base game, and was later available directly from the publisher Hans im Glück.

A second set of six Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise (Carcassonne: Corn Circles II) tiles come packaged in six mini-expansions for Carcassonne – one tile per expansion – released by Hans im Glück and 999 Games. These tiles can be used on their own or combined with the tiles from the first Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise expansion.
67055.name: Carcassonne: Die Kornkreise

67056.description:
Fantasy Flight Games has made a couple of bonus Alternative Endings available via the Talisman Support Pages.

Alternative Endings were introduced in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Frostmarch Expansion and will no doubt feature more as new expansions are released.

Danse Macabre is an Ending which requires Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion as it features the Grim Reaper himself from the expansion.

Of course, you will require the card back which is also available on the Talisman Support Page!
67056.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Danse Macabre

67057.description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Instructor Adventure card is a Stranger originally included in the Talisman: The Adventure for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar Place card was released as an Adventure card called the Academy in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.
67057.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Instructor

67058.description:
Fantasy Flight Games produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as preorder bonuses when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion via the FFG website or from their FLGS.

The Doppelganger Adventure card is an Enemy - Monster originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card is unlikely to be reprinted in a future expansion, a similar card was released as a Dungeon card called the Mimic in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Dungeon Expansion.

It was available in various languages from FFG's international partners and given away either with preorders or at launch events.
67058.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): Doppelganger

67059.description:
Black Industries produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition) from the BI website.

The Arena Adventure card was a Place originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card was never produced in another expansion under Black Industries, it did see mainstream publication for the Revised version of Talisman (Revised 4th Edition) under Fantasy Flight Games in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.
67059.name: Talisman (4th Edition): Arena

67060.description:
Black Industries produced two bonus Adventure Cards which were made available as when people ordered Talisman (Revised 4th Edition) from the BI website.

The Rod of Ruin Adventure card was a Magic Object originally included in the Talisman Expansion Set for Talisman.

Though the card was never produced in another expansion under Black Industries, it did see mainstream publication for the Revised version of Talisman (Revised 4th Edition) under Fantasy Flight Games in Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Reaper Expansion.
67060.name: Talisman (4th Edition): Rod of Ruin

67061.name: Right Ascension
67061.description:
New colonies need many things to survive... tools, food, raw materials, medicine, to name a few. Merchants and the ships they use to ply the stars are their salvation in many ways. You are one of those merchants. You are charged with ensuring that you are not only profitable, but you are keeping these new colonies alive and thriving in this backwater part of the galaxy.

You also have competitors... others who wish to attract the attention of the Emperor by being the best. You must struggle to supply systems with goods at a profit. You must also struggle to gain influence through your trade in key systems that will attract future rewards from the Emperor himself. But options are limited... you don’t hear of deliveries when needed and your opponents do.

You are beset with a changing political landscape in this sector as colonies grow. Demand for certain goods shifts like sand. Danger and discovery await. Your network of informants and insiders provide you with information. As time passes, it becomes harder to trade safely as success attracts attention — sometimes from unsavory characters. The finest merchants rise to this challenge, but they are ever-mindful of not making the Emperor jealous...

THIS is life in Right Ascension...

67062.name: Berliner Nacht
67062.description:
User Summary:

"Berliner Nacht" is a scenario book for Berlin XVIII second edition. There are seven scenarios:

- "La Nuit des gladiateurs" is about clandestine fighting competitions;

- "Le Falkampft sifflera trois fois" is set in England (with heavy Mad Max overtones);

- "Le Vengeur fou" has the players try to protect a mafia boss from a vigilante;

- "Le Jour où Berlin sauta (ou pas ?)" is about preventing a terrorist attack;

- "Meurtres dans les marches" send the players on an investigation on the eastern front;

- "Le Congrès" is about an international police convention in America, where things don't go quite as planned;

- "le Caissier voleur, sa femme et son amant" is half standard investigation, half vaudeville.

67063.name: Fault Line
67063.description:
User summary:

A 16 page adventure for the Marvel Super Heroes roleplaying game, setting Black Knight, Captain American, Spiderman and Wasp following mysterious clues and a trail of deadly villains. Includes a set of fold up figures.

From the back cover:

They are the last worlds of the dying man. "Fault...Line." What do they mean? How does it threaten New York? Who would kill to keep it a secret? Is there a rupture in the foundation under the Big Apple, or is there another meaning lurking in the cryptic confession?

Can SPIDER-MAN, CAPTAIN AMERICA, the WASP, and the BLACK KNIGHT save the city from certain destruction? Can the heroes solve the mystery, find the villain behind the evil plot, and beat the clock before the mighty metropolis runs out of time?

FAULT LINE is an adventure for use with the MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game. You must have the MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game to play this adventure. This package includes a 16-page adventure book, a full-color City Map and more than a dozen ADVENTURE FOLD-UP Figures.

67064.name: Flames of Doom
67064.description:
User summary:

A conclusion to the Future in Flames series. This details four possible scenarios to conclude the series, ranging from straightforward time traveling adventures to a complex campaign to liberate North America. Details for several kinds of Sentinel and supporting cast are included.

67065.name: Middleman
67065.description:
Middleman is an Icehouse game for two players. Middleman is like a 3D version of chess, where each piece has different movement rules. Large pieces move like bishops; medium pieces move like rooks; small pieces move like knights. The large and medium pieces are restricted to moving one or two spaces. The first player to form a tree of his or her own color pieces wins the game.

Middleman is played on a diamond sized chess board with a size of six squares across the middle. This diagram shows the board shape where the Xes represent the the playing surface of the board.

00XX00
0XXXX0
XXXXXX
XXXXXX
0XXXX0
00XX00

For a full description of the rules see http://www.icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Middleman

67066.description:
Objective: Be the first to cover all the spaces on their Zingo card with matching tiles. Each Zingo card is double sided: Green is easy and Red is more challenging.

The Zingo holder dispenses two tiles. These tiles have numbers on them. When player sees a space on their card with a number of items (i.e. 9 apples) matching the number on the tile (a 9) they take the tile and cover up the corresponding spaces on his/her Zingo card. Unclaimed tiles are placed back into the Zingo tile holder. If two players call the same tile, it goes to whoever called it first. The first player to cover all 9 spaces on their card shouts ZINGO and wins the game.

The game also comes with two variants: Mini-Zingo where the first player to match three images in a row up or down is the winner, and Zany Zingo where you select a pattern to match on your card. The first to match it wins.
67066.name: Zingo! 1-2-3

67067.description:
From the manufacturer: Watch Out! It's not nice to tease a crocodile...players try to cross the creek and avoid the dangerous snap of the crocodile. The first player to make it all the way around wins the game!

For 2 - 4 players, ages 3 and up.

Contents: 1 game board, 8 monkey pieces, 1 snapping crocodile, 1 spinner card and instructions
67067.name: Five Little Monkeys Can't Catch Me Game

67069.name: Ni Hao Kai-Lan Dragon Boat Race Game
67069.description: A spin and move race game for 2 to 4 players ages 3 and up. Be the first to win 3 races. Winner gets to wear the dragon mask and lead the Dragon Boat Festival Parade.

67070.name: Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game
67070.description:
Everybody is dead.

Okay, you’re still alive, but almost everybody else is dead. And the dead aren’t really dead, they’re un-dead, they’re hungry and they’re coming for YOU!

Can you survive a zombie apocalypse? Find out with The Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game!

The game includes six sheets of die-cut markers, equipment and vehicle pieces, an 11x17” cardstock playing board, an 8½ x 11” battle board, a complete rulebook and a survivor’s guide to the apocalypse with encounter charts and scrounging tables for all the locations on the board. Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

Players can work separately or cooperate as they try to survive to reach the zombie-free sanctuary. (If it really is zombie-free.) Players battle hordes of the undead, plus escaped criminals, redneck cannibals, rampaging marauders, corporate security goons, government troops and (maybe) each other for the food, fuel, equipment, weapons and ammo necessary to survive the zombie apocalypse.

It’s all here from every zombie movie you’ve ever seen: chainsaws, kukri, shotguns, the armored bus, the shopping mall, the farmhouse, secret underground lab, and more! Play against your choice of fast (28 Days Later-style) zombies or “classic” zombies.

The game play is fast and furious with combat almost every turn. May be played solitaire or with up to ten players. If you’re killed you just lose all your equipment and start over as somebody else. A great party game!

Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

You can buy on-line at www.fantasynations.com/

67071.name: Rugrats Party Whooper
67071.description:
From Nickelodeon. "A matching game for young party-goers!"

"The object of the game is race to Finish Space and be the first to claim the party gift which awaits."

A Rugrats themed remake of Candy Land manufactured in the Philippines. 2-6 players move their tokens along the track according to the results of a spinner device. Players do not move space by space but from their current space to the next space as indicated by the spinner. The spinner has five possible segments; forward, backward, cake, balloon and gift. First player to reach the end of the track wins.

67072.name: Shadis (Issue 15 - Sep 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Close Encounters of the Random Kind
Play-By-Mail: What does the future hold?
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
67072.description:
Volume 3, No. 3

From the table of contents:

Special Features

Pledging the Sorority - An introductory adventure to ManHunter
Psyberchology of Insanity - Insanity rules for Cyberpunk 2.0.2.0
Sentient Circuits Part 2 - Part 2 of a series on optional materials for GDW's Traveller: The New Era




Gamemaster's Workshop

Police Encounters - A generic system for handling brushes with the law
Magical Merchants - Generic non-player merchants make a buck by exploiting magic
Hook, Line and Sinker - Adventures on the Fly
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Generic non-player characters ready for action
Close Encounters of the Random Kind - Random encounter tables suitable for any system




Regular Departments

Mail Bag

Comics

Bright Future - The plot thickens
Finieous Fingers - The world's greatest thief returns
Joe Genero - This Issue: Joe pumps up!
Knights of the Dinner Table - The boys are at it again

67073.name: Kaj & Andrea på Spilopper
67073.description:
From the publisher:
Have a lots of fun with the naughty frog and the nice parrot - Kaj & Andrea. Game gives you many entertaining challenges! This game is made for the funniest disciplines. Can you example. stand on one leg and say, as a hen, or are you really good at flying? There are sure plenty of entertainment in this enjoyable game with both known and beloved characters from the television.
Children will try to do as their favorite TV character do on the cards! The first who get 10 of those card by doing right things needed, will win!

67074.name: Let's learn the Calendar
67074.description: The children are shown a card which has a date on it. The child who can find the correct day on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the date the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what day it is.

67075.name: Let's Learn the Professions
67075.description: The children are shown a card which has a profession on it. The child who can find the correct tool of that proffesion on his picture board wins the card. When the children learn to tell the professions the game can be played so that you only show the children a card and they tell you what tool it uses.

67076.name: Hop på toget: Danmark rundt
67076.description:
From the publisher:
Train Pillet is a traditional family game where players travel around Denmark crisscrossing and get interesting experiences in different cities. In this exciting game you must compete to be first submitted to the various stations. To change trains entails some risk, and bonus cards affect the game.
You win by getting through your given cities fastest!

67077.name: City of The Dead
67077.description:
It’s all gone to hell! You're a survivor, but there’s something you gotta do before you get out of town! Maybe it’s finding your husband, helping the guys from your precinct defend the hospital, getting your family to a safe zone or reporting for duty at the base.

On your own you're toast so maybe you'll hook up with some other survivors along the way, strength in numbers and all that. Maybe they'll help out, pull some strings with whoever is still out there to pull strings with. Don't forget the cops are out in force, hopefully they'll hold off the horde until the national guard get here or you could always give 'em a hand!

Can you make a last stand, unite the people of your town and hold back the tide of undead? Will you evacuate city blocks before they get infected? Can you get them to safezones or are you leading them into a trap? Will you lead the army or the police in counterattacks or try to figure out the cause of the threat with CDC? Will you help rally the townspeople and defeat the source of the zombies or leave ‘em to rot and get out of dodge with whatever and whoever you can find?

- Current Summary from the Designer
- This game is currently in development by the designer to be published through new imprint MODIPHIUS.

67080.description:
Flume is an extremely simple game for two players. Start with a Go board lined with a perimeter of green stones (painted on). The players, Red and Blue, take turns adding stones of their own color. If you add a stone which forms 3 or 4 connections (orthogonal adjacencies) with neighboring stones of any color (red, blue or green) add another stone while it's still your turn. And so on. Your turn concludes when you add a stone which forms 2 or less connections with neighboring stones. The object is to have the most stones on the board after it has been filled with stones.

Flume gameplay is strongly related to Dots and Boxes gameplay.
67080.name: Flume

67081.name: X
67081.description:
X is a simple game for 3 players which employs an ordinary rhombus board with a hexagonal pattern of cells. The three players, Red, Yellow and Green, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board. A corner of the rhombus is claimed by the player with the outermost path connecting the corner's two adjacent sides.

The object is to claim the maximum unique number of corners.

67082.description: Rommel is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as motorized infantry. His special abilites allow him to move twice or move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.
67082.name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Rommel

67083.description: Patton is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as Armor. His special abilites allow him to move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.
67083.name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Patton

67084.description:
A board wargame of the European and North African theaters in World War II. The War ("TW") is a hex-and-counter strategic-level game which aims to provide the challenge of a monster game with the ease of play of a moderate complexity war game. Experienced players should be able to play a campaign game in a weekend.

The game includes several scenarios designed to be fun, challenging mini-games in their own right, each playable in an afternoon. An array of variants and optional rules offers enough scope to make TW most replayable.



(from Compass Games website)The War: Europe 1939-1945 (TW) is Compass Games’ new WWII strategic level game combining all the best features of the genre into an intuitive, challenging new game. While offering all the expansive features of the WWII Monster Game genre (such as U-Boat warfare, diplomacy, espionage, strategic bombing, jets, rockets and numerous variants for each Major Power), TW also offers tremendous scope in its 12 scenarios (see below).

Although not a card driven game (and thus a good candidate for solitaire play), TW includes card play for the U-Boat War, Strategic Bombing, Espionage and Counter Espionage and naval warfare. The cards add elements of bluff and surprise more traditional hex-and-combat-table games cannot. But they’re optional, so TW can be played solitaire in a way CDG’s and block games cannot. Between two (or more) skilled players, no two games are ever likely to be the same. For multiplayer games, up to five gamers can play Campaign Games as Italy, Germany, France, the U.S., Britain and USSR.

For the hard-core military and naval history buff, TW addresses the details of WWII strategy: what if the Germans really built the carrier Graf Zeppelin; what if Mussolini had upgraded the quality of Italian forces; what if Stalin hadn’t shot many of his best generals during the purges; what if the U.S. had entered the war earlier…or later; what if the British had been able to mobilize the Empire and the Dominions more effectively; what if the U.S. had developed the atomic bomb early enough to use in Europe, and so on.

Although the game is the result of extensive research by its designer, TW isn’t a simulation and isn’t intended to be. It’s a "gamer’s game" with quick, user-friendly combat systems on land, in the air and at sea. Veteran gamers familiar with classic WWII strategic level games should pick up the game very quickly. For new recruits, the short scenarios teach the basics, but can be played as stand-alone games in their own right. Both realistic and playable, TW should present a rewarding challenge for any WWII strategy game buff.

Scenario List for The War: Europe 1939-1945:

1939 Full War Campaign
1941 Campaign
1942-43 Turning Point Campaign
Poland 1939
Norway 1940
France 1940
Barbarossa 1941
North Africa 1941-43
The Atlantic Lifeline 1939-45
Bolshevik Hordes 1944-45
Regia Marina
D-Day to VE Day 1944-45




Complexity: High (about 8 out of 10)
Playing Time: 50 hours for full campaign (1.5 hours and up for scenarios)
Solitaire Suitability: Good

Designer: Ernie Copley
Developer: Paul Shackleton
Artist: Mark Mahaffey

Components:

2 maps
9 full sheets of 5/8” counters
Approximately 20 full color 8.5" x 11" cards with various displays, tracks, reminders, tables, charts, worksheets, etc.
1 rules booklet
1 scenario booklet
1 deck of variant cards
2 dice
1 full color box and lid – the big 3” deep box
67084.name: The War: Europe 1939-1945

67085.name: Shadis (Issue 16 - Nov 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Close Encounters of the Random Kind
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
67085.description:
Volume 3, No. 4

From the table of contents:

Special Features

Wide-Awake in Slumberland - New uses for virtual reality in Underground
A Taste of Armageddon - Nuclear weapons in Twilight 2000
Ridiculous Manor - A generic adventure




Gamemaster's Workshop

Tuning Your Armies - A quick and dirty system for giving your NPC armies some extra punch
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Generic non-player characters ready for action
Hook, Line and Sinker - Adventures on the Fly
Close Encounters of the Random Kind - Random encounter tables suitable for any system




Regular Departments

Cries from the Attic - Editorial of a Madman
Mail Bag
Knight Gallery - An Artist Showcase: Anthony P. Szczudlo
Zine Scene - A closer look at the small press world
SHADIS Con-Nection - A listing of gaming conventions
Up My Sleeve - The world of card games
Closer Look - Reviews: Games, Books, etc.
Disks of Wondrous Power - Computer game reviews
Bits n' Pieces - News and Rumors
New Perspectives - The world of miniatures
Post Marque - A mini-magazine on PBM games
Market Platz - Classified, announcements, conventions, etc.




Comics

Finieous Fingers - The world's greatest thief returns
Bright Future - The plot thickens
Joe Genero - This Issue: Joe jst stands there!
Knights of the Dinner Table - The boys are at it again

67086.name: Nak
67086.description:
From the Back of the Box:

The object of the game is to reach the score of 21. Each player gets to flick three NAK pieces. The first player reaching the score of 21 or more is the winner. A set of dice adds to the fun and excitement. To complete the challenge and skill of the game there are two additional holes in the board, a pink hole and a blue hole; the hopes and hazards of each player. For these holes there are two sets of cards, a pink set and a blue set. Each time a player's NAK piece falls into either of these holes the corresponding card is selected and the special instructions are followed.

67088.name: Rock'n Reptiles
67088.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Join your friends in a thrilling, exciting and fun race through Rock'n Reptiles. Simplified play for young children with easy to follow instructions.

User Summary:

Players take turns spinning a coloured spinner and moving their playing piece to the closest space with the colour shown (very much like Candyland). When a player first passes one of the eight marked locations, they take the corresponding location card. There is only one card for each location. The player with the most location cards by the end of the game is the winner.

67102.name: I en god sags tjeneste
67102.description:
Translatated from the back of the book:

In en god sags tjeneste is a campaign for Fusion the RPG (Høst & Søn, 2000). It consists of 7 scenarios, which together tells an exciting thriller about terrorism and conspiracy on an international level. The book also contains nearly 30 pages with extra material and handouts, as well as a thoroughly researched background for role-playing in a dark Europe.

67103.name: Som landet ligger
67103.description:
Translated from the back of the book:

67108.name: Champions of the North 4th Edition
67108.description:
From the back cover:

So,you've battled Eurostar in Paris and thwarted Dr. Destroyer in the jungles of Peru. You've probably been to the moon or even beyond. And now you think you've seen it all.

Think again Heroes! There's a land of mystery and adventure that you are probably overlooking. A land filled with heroes and villains all its own. This land, of course, is Canada, the realm of the Champions of the North.

Champions of the North is a sourcebook for Champions, completely describing America's northern neighbor and the heroes and villains who live there. Inside you will find dozens of new characters, three fully detailed adventures, and many more adventure ideas. For the GM, there are extensive notes on Canada, its people, its history, and detailed descriptions of the cities and locations for your northern adventures. Whether your heroes are just visiting or are settling in for a full scale Canadian campaign, Champions of the North is the sourcebook for you (eh?).

67111.name: Berlin XVIII (Third Edition)
67111.description:
User Summary:

The third edition of Berlin XVIII takes places 4 years after the previous editions. The world is still dark and depressing.

The rules have been streamlined (10 pages of rules, including character creation). The rest of the book includes:

- expanded background information

- chapters about forensics and criminology

- a long description of sektor XVIII written by a former falkampft, information on prisons, justice, the media and the other neighboring sektors.

- a catalog of weapons, vehicles (along with a description of the relevant legislation) and drugs (including their production modes and their effects).

- 2 scenarios ("Première affaire" and "De la part de vieux potes"), the first being an introductory scenario where the player characters are interns, the other serving as a transition between second and third editions.

67112.description:
A Brazilian game that simulates the deterrence period of the cold war, by means of tile drawing.

During the game the players alternate at drawing 3 tiles, revealing then to the opponent. Then, the player selects one and reveals one of the other 2 to the opponent, placing it in one of his/her main cities.

During the game, players may decide to start a nuclear war, a situation of great responsability to the attacker in which, unless he his utterly succesful, he will be blamed, by the world and by history, as the destroyer of the world (therefore, losing the game). That means that the only way to win the game via attack is by destroying one of your opponent's cities, while having none of yours destroyed by the automatic countermeasures systems of the opponent.

And, after the deterrence period, if neither nuclear power attacks, the winner is the one with the strongest economy, decided, also, by the tiles pulled.

All in all, it is a game of deduction, where you must always evaluate your strength vs the possibility of being attacked by your opponent, and how strong you are economically.

Will you be able to survive the deterrence?

67121.name: Hofnar
67121.description: A partygame where the challenge is building words letter by letter. Example: When the first player spins the spinner and gets the letter "B" he thinks of a word (board), so now he says out loud the second letter in that word "O", the next player now builds on from those two letters, but thinks of another word (Boulder) and says out loud the next letter in that word "U". Etc. Play continues until a player cannot add a letter or only has the option to add the final letter to make a complete word.

67123.description:
From the publishers website:

"June 6, 1944.
The Allies land in Normandy to liberate France from German rule. The liberation however, won’t be an easy road. From D-Day at Omaha Beach, through the battle for Normandy, the Allies will fight the Germans tooth and nail, bayonet and rifle, tank on tank."

Tank on Tank is a new Peter Bogdasarian design. A smaller game that can be learned in less than five minutes and played during a lunch break, Tank on Tank depicts tactical ground combat in Europe in the latter years of World War II.


The scale? It doesn’t really matter in Tank on Tank, let’s just call it tactical.
The units? Tank on Tank includes Shermans, Wolverines, Priests, Tigers, Mark IVs, as well as the infantry and anti-tank guns that fought alongside them.
If you’ve been looking for a simple game to scratch that tactical itch, or something to introduce a young tactician to war gaming, Tank on Tank might be the answer.


This game is out of print. and the latest editions can be found below.


Tank on Tank: West Front
Tank on Tank: East Front
boardgameversion: Lock 'N Load Publishing English First Edition

67128.description:
From the back cover:

Here be dragons!

In the modern world, the walking legends known as Bygones are considered mythology. To those who stand beside them, however, such beasts are very, very real.

...And Unicorns and Gryphons and Other, Darker Things.

See the world through the eyes of a beast iin this crossover book of mythical creatures. An essential tome for dark fantasy games, The Bygone Bestiary includes:


Descriptions, folklore, roleplaying hints and systems for dozens of creatures, both magical and mundane.



Character creation rules, new Traits and Storyteller suggestioins.



Suitable for Mage: The Sorcerors Crusade, Mage: The Ascension, Changeling The Dreaming, and Vampire: The Dark Ages

67129.name: Let's Play Vegas
67129.description:
Las Vegas Style "Let's Play Vegas"
The Non-Stop Game of Skill, Chance and Action Among Players.

Players start out on a track that is ment to be the "strip" and "fremont street" as you work your way from arrival, back to the airport to leave. ALong the way you land on spaces that allow you to gamble and proform other actions. The player with the most cash at the end wins!

67130.name: Form Pack
67130.description:
User Summary:

Contains multiple copies of three Alpha Complex forms in triplicate (real carbon paper!), and a short bureaucratic adventure, A Hole in The Complex, which revolves around filling and filing these forms.

The forms are:
- Form Request Form 2212/HHK (10x)
- Equipment/Weapon/Vehicle Request Form (4x)
- Equipment Complaint Form B4379-10(398)/7R (4x)

67131.description:
User Summary:

The Koros core rules are made up of 6 booklets slipped into the gamemaster screen.

- the rules book (8 pages) contains the standard Universom rules

- the Civilization book (24 pages) describes the world of Koros (history of the moons of Koros, fauna, spaceships, medicine, robots and other gear) and adds setting-specific rules (character creation, psychic combat, space travel)

- the third book (20 pages) is a scenario called "Les Damnés", with pre-generated characters.

67132.name: Thryra
67132.description:
User Summary:

Thryra is a campaign setting for Koros. It describes the planet Thryra and its inhabitants, a race of tall, hairy humanoids whose sole belief is natural selection.

Several chapters describe Thryran culture and technology, thryran space fleets....

The book ends with a scenario with pregenerated thryran characters, designed to allow the players to discover this new world.

rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele

User summary:

This book contains two adventures which take place in the town Tidford.
The first adventure of 19 pages is "Garan, der Bettlerjunge" by Thomas Kerßebaum and Stephanie Lammers. It is meant to be played by characters of little experience.
The second adventure of 33 pages is "Der Thronerbe" by Dr. Rainer Nagel. It is meant to be played by characters of medium experience. The group should have at least two magicians.
You can use the source book "Tidford - Stadt am Tuarisc" for these adventures but the necessary information is also included in this book.

67136.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The game contains:

* A 40 pages rule book with the rules for 12 games, including game samples
* 32 playing cards
* All that in a metal box

12 games to teach progressively substraction and addition.

Using well known game designs: Rummy, Old Maid, War and variants using the "Mistigri" card and the "Cameleon" card.
Whoever owns The "Mistigri" loses the game.
WIle the "Cameleon" card acts as a wild card.

rpg: Judge Dredd the Role-Playing Game (Games Workshop)
67137.name: Judgement Day
67137.description:
From the Back Cover:

Judgement Day is an intriguing investigation for a team of 2-4 Judges of average experience or 4-6 newly-appointed Judges. This package is not a complete game in itself; you will need Judge Dredd - The Roleplaying game to play this adventure.

It's two in the morning. A team of Judges glides through the deserted streets surrounding the old Maze development area, looking in vain for the occasional insomniac perp to arrest. It's a very quiet night, with few of the shift's major incidents catching the attention of the Judges as they drift over their bikes radios. The mob war is continuing to rage across the northern sectors - another two-bit gangster has been terminated by the opposition tonight. A massive new tower block has been found to be infested with Rad-Fleas, and is presently under strict quarantine while emergency Med-Squads desperately battle to fumigate the building on time. Some crazy citizen has taken it into his head to fire quided missiles at Zoom-tube trains as they pass, presumably just for the fun of it. On the whole, though, it's been quiet ....

Not very far away, though, a shadowy figure is putting the finishing touches to a plan that will put the whole of the Mega-City at risk. If the plan is allowed to succeed, the judges will once again be faced with the threat of chaos and anarchy, when the most evil criminal mind the Mega-City has ever known returns to claim what's his, on JUDGEMENT DAY!!

67139.name: Silrin
67139.description:
User Summary:

The Silrin core rules are composed of 3 softcover books slipped into the gamemaster screen.

The first book (8 pages) contains the Universom rules.

The second book (28 pages) describes the world of Silrin, with a map of the continent, chapters about each race, fauna, and additional rules for character creation (allowing to create a character of any of the four sentient races), gear, vehicles, special powers like the Celnack nobles' ability to fly, social statuses...

The third book (also 28 pages) is a scenario ("l'héritage d'Arthron") with pre-generated characters, a Celnack noble and his retainers who go on a quest to retrieve three artifacts to fulfill a prophecy.

The game also contains a character sheet and the gamemaster's screen.

67141.description:
User Summary:

The gamemaster screen for Berlin XVIII second edition contains a 4-panels screen and an 8-page booklet with a scenario ("Les Kids de Limerick") about a terrorist plot from Brittany nationalists.

67142.name: Ecran pour Berlin XVIII troisième édition
67142.description:
User Summary:

The gamemaster's screen for Berlin XVIII third edition contains a 4-panel screen and an 8 pages book with a scenario ("Babel One") about a murder investigation.

67143.name: Plunk A Skunk
67143.description:
"Looking to get out a little pent-up aggression but don't feel like destroying your flatware? Plunk-A-Skunk is for you. Fans of the Whack-A-Mole carnival game found on Jersey Shore boardwalks will be familiar with this game's manic bonking action. As each of the skunk heads on the playing field light up you have to ding them with the padded Plunk-A-Skunk mallet to score points. Bang away and skunks taunt and praise you with phrases like "Time is running out" and "You're awesome."

Electronic game, home variant of the popular arcade/funfair game where small creatures (usually crocodiles or gophers) pop in and out of holes in the board, and the players score points by hitting ("plunking") them with inflatable mallets. This variant uses skunk faces that randomly light up; the player scores points by hitting a skunk face when it is illuminated.

Mildly amusing fun, with limited replay value, and fresh batteries are a must.

67144.description:
At the fish market there are five stalls, each specializing in a different type of Seafood and the stall keepers try to do good business. During the day the prices rise and fall according to demand. No one should be left with the Seafood whose price has crashed!

Winner of "Best Card Game" prize at "Premio Archimede" 2008 with the name "Portobello Road"
67144.name: Frutti di Mare

67146.name: Berlin Confidential
67146.description:
User Summary:

The Berlin Confidential sourcebook for the third edition of Berlin XVIII offers a bit of everything. There are articles about the economic situation in 2070, interpol, more details about the day-to-day life in law enforcement (including examples of paperwork to fill), the legal prostitution system, activist groups (anarchists and others), and serial killers.

There are also three scenarios: "les Ombres du passé" is about political activists, "Fire and forget" is an action scenario, and "Wolf" is about the hunt for a serial killer.

67147.name: L'Espaniya
67147.description:
User Summary:

L'Espaniya is a french sourcebook for the Hawkmoon RPG describing Spain during the Tragic Millenium.

The book describes Espaniya in general, then focus on each region, detailing history, climate, fauna, politics, economy, religions and cults, interesting place to visit, important people, military might...

The book ends with a 44 pages campaign titled "Le jour où la foudre coulera...", which have the players look for a technological secret all across Espaniya.

67148.description:
Ultimate Werewolf: Compact Edition is "Ultimate Werewolf in your pocket," with 40 cards, dozens of roles and a comprehensive set of rules. Fully compatible with Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition (if you need extra cards for more players) and Ultimate Werewolf: Classic Movie Monsters. While compact, this version of Ultimate Werewolf plays up to 34 players at one time!

67149.name: At The Crossroads of Sanctuary & Salvation
rpg: Annalise: Stories of Pain, Hunger & Redemption
67149.description:
From the introduction:

This Guided Play Scenario is designed for one-shot, introductory, and convention play of Annalise. It provides a setting, a situation, characters and some of the surrounding fiction (some NPCs, Claims, and so forth).

It’s 1947 and Sanctuary is the picture perfect model for small town living in the American South. Everyone knows each other’s names, goes to church on Sunday, and knows that Bascomb’s Diner has been serving the best grits for over thirty years. The mayor will tell you they call it Sanctuary because folks know how to keep their problems behind closed doors; when trouble starts they have the decency to mind their own business. All of that changed one humid summer day when a mysterious traveling salesman named Quentin Drake came to town. With his felt hat, crisp wool suit and shiny leather shoes, everyone knows a perfect gentleman when they see one. And while it may not come out of that fancy looking case he carries, he always has what you need. Don’t worry about the cost; you needn’t always pay in cash.

67150.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 37 - 1993)
67150.description:
Table of Contents
Runes (Editorial & Credits - Stewart Wieck)
From The Pack (Letters)
The Treasure of Galilee (Pendragon Adventure - Paul Cockburn)
The Spokesman Speaks (Excerpts from Flagship Magazine)
Mind Over Matter (Mage: The Ascension Adventure - Chris Hind)
Feature Review: The Masquerade (Roger Spendlove)
Feature Review: Earthdawn (Stewart Wieck)
Feature Review: Underground (Stewart Wieck)
Artist Spotlight (Barbara Armata)
The World of Future Darkness (Part 2 of 3 of our Cyber-Vamp Setting - Deirdre Brooks)
The Silicon Dungeon (Computer Games - Jim Trunzo)
Feature Review: Blood Pit (Stewart Wieck)
Capsule Reviews
Top Twenty Lists
On The Horizon (Next Issue)

67151.name: Mage: The Ascension Storytellers Screen
67151.description:
User description:

This three panel screen came bundled with the 16 page adventure Angel of Mercy.

67152.name: Drums around the Fire
67152.description:
From the back cover:

Legends of the Garou

Gaia is in pain. The Earth Mother is torn by the vile talons of the Wyrm, the dragon of destruction. Only Her children can stand before it -- only the Garou, the werewolves, can hope to stop it.

The Garou live in a dying world,, a wilderness ravaged by the forces of greed and corruption. From the heroic Silver Fangs to the techno-savvy Glass Walkers, the 13 tribes use all their powers of spirit and nature to defend the earth.

These are their tales...

At the dawn of history, a Garou hero must fight against the most dreaded minion of the Wyrm... in the heart of a modern city, a Glass Walker learns a dangerous lesson in honor... a young pack fights to save children from the clutches of corruption... to save his people, a Stargazer must discover the secret of a dying bear... a Garou is forever changed by the dark vision revealed in the heat of the unleashed atom...

...these tales and more are told to strengthen the Garou for their final fight: the Apocalypse.

67153.name: The Time Traveller's Companion
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Supplement - Silver Winner
2013 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
67153.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Time flies when you're having fun, but flying through time can present a whole host of problems. Whether accidentally creating paradoxes, upsetting the course of history or trying to Put Things Right, you're going to need to know your way around the Vortex. You need a guide…a companion.

This supplement for Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space gives more information on Time Lords, temporal mechanics and time machines. It also takes an in-depth look at earth's important role in time and space, covering prehistory to the 51st Century - a vital aid for running historical campaigns at any time in earth's colourful history.

67154.name: The Wake of Zenas Quantum
rpg: Annalise: Stories of Pain, Hunger & Redemption
67154.description:
From the introduction:

This Guided Play Scenario is designed for one-shot, introductory, and convention play of Annalise. It provides a setting, a situation, characters and some of the surrounding fiction (NPC names, some Claims, and so forth). It is assumed that the player facilitating the scenario be familiar with the rules of the game. A copy of Annalise is required for play of this Guided Play Scenario.

When Zenas Quantum, the Superpositioned Man, dies in Oubliette Asylum, the Heroic Agency breathes a collective sigh of relief. No longer do they have to protect Saga City from a man who can be everywhere at once. But not long after Zenas’s death, strange goings-on remove any ease the heroes might have. Is it a copycat, a clone, a government plot, an alien? Or merely coincidental? Is Zenas Quantum dead after all, or are the members of the Heroic Agency merely jumping at shadows?

67157.name: Escape from Sembia
67157.description:
ESCAPE FROM SEMBIA is a Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition preview adventure released through D&D Experience and RPGA.

From the Publisher:

"You weren’t looking for trouble in civilized lands, just some good adventuring leads. Before you knew what was really happening, you wound up in the middle of an information exchange, and now you have to escape from the lands of Sembia to preserve your very lives! Off the beaten path to shake any pursuers, you take to the wilds in the hope that you’ll reach a safe haven before you’re captured.
Escape from Sembia is a Forgotten Realms adventure for five 1st-level characters and is a preview of the 4th Edition D&D game. The adventure has several decision points, but mostly consists of linear encounters that allow players to try out their characters’ abilities and learn the game."

Six pregenerated characters are included with the adventure.

boardgamecompilation: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition For Kickstarter
67161.description:
Ultimate Werewolf: Classic Movie Monsters is an expansion that includes six all-new roles, including The Blob, Frankenstein's Monster, Teenage Werewolf and more. For instance, The Blob slowly oozes across the village, one player at a time; if everyone in the village is part of The Blob, that player wins! Frankenstein's Monster gets special powers from other players as they die, becoming a great asset to the village as the game progresses. Teenage Werewolf is so excited to be a werewolf that each day he must say "Werewolf!"

This expansion is fully compatible with Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition, Ultimate Werewolf: Compact Edition,Ultimate Werewolf, and Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition.
67161.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Classic Movie Monsters

67162.name: Wenn Engel fallen
67162.description:
(translated from the back of the book)

This book contains the scenario "Wenn Engel fallen" and the new linked Hexer-short story "Der Sturmbringer" by Wolfgang Hohlbein.
In a death fight in the far east Robert Craven must fight off a quite unusual attack in China in "Der Sturmbringer", and in "Wenn Engel fallen" the players characters beach at the side of Richard Craven - the Hexer's son - on an unknown island, where they will be exposed to a staccato of strange perils. This beginner-friendly scenario is so fast und furios that old role playing veterans will be as entangled by it as newbies.

67163.name: Der Teufelsplan des Fu Manchu
67163.description:
(translated from the back of the book)

Autumn 1925 - while searching for ultimate power, Dr. Fu Manchu has a stranglehold over the British capital. Siding with organized crime, the player characters fight fire with fire.

Meanwhile Robert Craven, the Hexer (warlock) of Salem, experiences the sequel of "Der Sturmbringer" in "Die Insel der Schrecken", a new exclusive short story by Wolfgang Hohlbein.

67164.name: Tage des Mondes
67164.description:
(translated from the back of the book)

February 1926 - the player characters are confronted with a task of new dimensions. "Tage des Mondes" draws them deeper in the abyss of the human soul than they could ever have dreamed. While they fight off the claws of madness, a wolf howls the background music at the full moon.
In the new exclusive short story "Der Feuerteufel" bey Wolfgang Hohlbein, Robert Craven odyssey through the far east comes to a fiery finale.

67165.name: Doodle Pix
67165.description:
From manufacturer's website:

THE CLASSIC GAME OF PICS & SKETCHES

In this doodling game, players put their drawing skills to the test in a race against the clock. Players take turns drawing everything from athletic events to zoo animals. It’s a great game for parties and family get-togethers. Great content, great pricing, and eye-catching packaging!

Contents
-Doodle Pix Cards
-Game Board
-Game Pawns
-Drawing Pads
-Pencils
-Sand timer

67166.name: Who, What & Where
67166.description:
From the publisher:

THE CLASSIC GAME OF PEOPLE, THINGS & PLACES

This name-dropping party game challenges players to describe for their teammates a host of people, places and things it could be anything from Aladdin, Acupuncture, or Abbey Road to Zebras, Zurich, or even Zappa! Great fun for two teams and packed with content, this party in a box will get everyone guessing and laughing out loud.

Contents
-Who Cards, What Cards, Where Cards
-Game board
-Game pawns
-Sand timer

67167.name: Planeten Spiel
67167.description:
The gameboard is divided in seven fields, from the top to the bottom: 3, 1 & 3. At the top one can see the planets: Saturn, Jupiter and Mars. In the middle: the Sun. At the bottom: Venus, the moon of the Earth and Mercury.

Published in Augsburg, Germany.

67168.name: Der Siebener
67168.description: A gameboard with nine panels, four to the left and right and one in the middle. Each panel has a joker and a number. The drinking joker in the middle is number 7. To the left one can see the numbers 2-6 and to the right 8-12.

67169.name: Team Talk
67169.description:
6 players: The players are divided into two teams, where one player is assigned to guess. The two other players in the same team now takes turn adding one word to a sentence about the word that has to be guessed.

4 players: The players are divided into two teams, one player from each team is assigne to guess. The other players now takes turn adding one word to a sentence about the word that has to be guessed.

67170.name: Sagan om ringen - Rollspelet
67170.description:
User summary:

The Swedish version/translation of Middle-earth Role Playing (1st & 2nd Editions). The boxed set contains the following:


A 62 page rules booklet.
A 54 page booklet detailing Middle-Earth and a short adventure.
A 48 page booklet with charts.
A 24 page adventure booklet.
Two ten-sided dice.


It includes some short conversion rules between Sagan om ringen - Rollspelet and the Swedish RPG Drakar och Demoner Expert.

67171.name: Das Lied der Elfen
67171.description:
From the back of the book (translated):
If you want to play an elf as your next hero, then this solitaire adventure is the right beginning for the career of a new hero of the dark eye.
Catch the first salmon of the spring, hunt the fox, run with the antelopes, dance with the wolf, and search for the strangest all creatures - humans! Turn into animal form, run, fly and dive through the wilderness. Try to find the spring of the magical river kvill, discover its fascination - and also escape from it again!
This play assistance is the ideal addition to the box Dunkele Städte, Lichte Wälder and contains all information, in order to create a elven hero. The solitaire adventure was written expressly for the role playing and the magic of an elf. Never before could you experience the natural magic of an elf so variant-rich and colorful, and never before you could experience so directly, what means it to play elf.

67172.name: Flag Grid
67172.description:
Flag Grid is a two player game played on a 9x9 square board.
On each turn,a player must move one of his stones.
