67374.name: XtraHeart
67374.description:
From the website:
"A game of Super Heroes with Chess like strategies.
You can play many combinations of Heroes and Powers, and in each game you can combine different heroes with different Side Kicks".

XtraHeart is a two player card game. Each player controls three home base zones where they secretly place their Headquarters and two Auxiliary bases. Players attempt to occupy their opponent's Headquarters or both of their Auxiliary bases to win the game.
The cards consist of Heroes, Side Kicks and Powers cards. Players build combinations of these cards and move out in to one of the three central outer space zones in order to battle their opponent's card combinations.

67375.name: Mayhem Rail
67375.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The City of Mayhem just got commuter friendly (although I suppose that depends on who’s along for the ride)! Re-enact your favorite epic superhero and action-star battles at high speed with ‘Mayhem Rail’. Finally we have a subway train and all the accoutrements to attach to those ‘Streets of Mayhem’ rail tiles! Mayhem fanatics REJOICE! This electrifying modelset expansion to Mayhem is Scott Reid’s first release at WorldWorks Games and we can’t tell you how proud we are to have a talent like his onboard. This is just the start of a promising line-up of work from this talented creator.

‘Mayhem Rail’ offers gamers a unique opportunity to play both inside and out of subway cars and more importantly you can build as many train cars as you want for pennies! With fully removable roofing and incredible WWG caliber detail in every train car, you’ll be astounded by the realism and grit shown in these models. Every detail is represented right down to the “questionable” seating, the sticky handrails, the garbage strewn flooring and those oh so entertaining dubious in-car ads. ;) Both clean and graffiti versions are represented giving you the option to dress your train cars in a suitable grim for those neglected corners of your city or shinny and new for the more civilized parts of town. And it doesn’t stop there; Scott even included raised subway station platforms for your citizens to board at each stop! Tie that all together with a number of props and custom ground tiles and you have yourself a fantastic addition to your growing city! The action possibilities are endless, just think of the chaos you can create with this one addition to Mayhem!
So what’s include with Mayhem Rail? Here’s the big breakdown:

Subway Platforms
o 1-inch, 1.5-inch and no-grid versions are all represented
o Optional platform roofing
o Platform ramps
o Platform bikerack (with bikes in 8 colors!)
o Platform ticket machines
o Platform benches
o Steel Support columns
o Station street signage
Rail Add-ons
o Exclusive “down” rail tile leading to the future ‘Mayhem Subway’ expansion
o Rail signal posts with ladder and crowsnest attachments
o Freestanding grey cinder block walls with and without graffiti and posters!
Subway Cars
o Both “Graffiti” and “Clean” versions of rail cars are supplied
o “Graffiti” and “Clean” windows transparencies
o Driver compartment with control panel, seat and cabinet separator
o 6”X3” Passenger compartments with hand rails and seating
o Removable roofing elements
o Fully detailed undercarriage for those “Hollywood derailings”!
o Working doors!
o Train mounted destination markers
o And as always this product comes with fully detailed step-by-step photographed instructions to guide you through the building process

67376.name: Circle's Winner
67376.description:
Are you more cunning, devious and brilliant than your friends? Are you sure?

Now you can prove it...

You only know the identity of one piece on the board - yours. And your goal is to simply move the piece to the center circle before any of your opponents pieces reach there first. But wait, not so fast. If anyone finds out which piece is yours you're sure to lose!

A simple game with simple rules; yet requiring a not-so-simple strategy of guile and cunning to win.

Practically the easiest "print and play" game possible. Just print, scrounge up some unique pieces (or cut out the ones provided) and you're ready to play. -> SEE THE FILE BELOW


Note: At present only the basic board is uploaded. Additional boards with unique scoring systems will be added later.

67377.description:
Master and Commander is a print'n'play game of 18th century naval combat. Players will maneuver their sailing ships in a hex grid sea in an effort to cross their opponents T (naval lingo for getting into a good firing position), or even board and capture an enemy vessel to use it against him. Victory is achieved by either sinking all enemy ships or chasing them out of the sea. Rules allow for changing wind conditions, crew quality, and shore batteries.

The game includes six pages of rules, double-sided counters for 40 ships, and two sheets of hex grid.

Master and Commander is a fast-play simulation of Napoleonic sea combat. Release 2.0 expands the beautiful counter set created by Tom Cundiff, adds rules for crew quality and provides hexagonal grid templates for map creation.
67377.name: Master and Commander
boardgameexpansion: Napoleonic Naval Combat Scenarios: American War of Independence Edition

67378.name: The Rifter (Issue 30 - Apr 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Congratulations on Knights of the Dinner Table # 100
From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
67378.description:
From the back cover:

Issue number 30 presents optional rules, new O.C.C.s, a new mystical martial art, magic, monsters and demons and imagination unleashed. Plus Palladium's 2005 product schedule and catalog, our convention schedule and a glimpse at books to come.

Rifts Chaos Earth - Blue Zone Demons.
Rifts RPG Candle Magic.
Splicers - New War Mounts and adventure ideas.
A Cut Above - a ton of optional rules and ideas suitable for adaption to any or all of Palladium's universal game system.
Phase World fiction: The Hammer of the Forge.
News and Happenings.

67379.name: Interpol Calling
67379.description: From the game cover: Enthralling game of international intrigue, based on the fascinating exciting television series from the 1950's starring Charles Korvin as Paul Duval. Pursuit of criminals by international police throughout many countries of the world.

67380.name: Empires & Dynasties
rpgissuearticle: Epreuve du feu: Empires et Dynastie
67380.description:
User Summary:

The Empires & Dynasties box contains everything needed to play:

- 2 68 pages books. The first "Le monde de Reah", contains the main rules, the character creation system, the experience system, and a description of the game world, including an overview of the grammar and pronunciation of the Reahn language. The second book contains chapters about magic (including rules), religion, technology, a bestiary and an introduction scenario, "La disgrâce".

- a 3 panels gamemaster screen

- a 80×60 cm map of the game world.

67381.description:
A Chinese checkers-like game where a player has to bring one of his stones to the opposite corner of the board.

Stones move by going through special "gates" from one board cell to another. Once a stone goes through a "gate", the "gate" turns 90 degrees so it connects a different pair of board cells.

A player can also win the game by leaving the opponent without possible moves.
67381.name: Gate

67382.name: Hydro Lord
67382.description:
From the rules introduction.
You are broke and have never succeeded financially. This time however it is going to be different, you manage to save a handful of dollars and decide to exit the rat race. You begin by investing in a business set-up; four months later you reap the rewards. Things are going smoothly, the money starts to roll in when suddenly your mates see a chopper overhead; but you are too late. Your business set-up is raided. This is one of the many scenarios that may happen to you.
Be captivated by sheer exhilaration as the game takes hold and catapults you into the secret lives of the pursued.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game, becomes Hydro Lord. Good luck.

67383.name: L'art de la guerre
67383.description:
User Summary:

The first Empires & Dynasties sourcebook focuses on the Ney-Dora empire military. The book includes a presentation of the imperial forces, an analysis of the geopolitical situation, chapters about the army organization (hierarchy, recruitment, uniforms...), equipment (weapons, armor and other gear), siege technology, a system for simulating mass combat, and additional rules for wounds and healing.

The book ends with a campaign ("Aventures en Rotzavan") for military characters, set in the war between the Empire and its eastern neighbour, Rotzavan.

The book also comes with a 80x40cm map of the Shubermanii imperial province.

67386.description:
Test your knowledge of ITV's longest running and most popular soap opera, Emmerdale. A fun quiz for the whole family, the game features more than 700 questions and classic clips from the show, with an emphasis on the contemporary storylines.

Choose from a selection of characters, but beware who you choose because there are forfeits for bad behaviour!
Multiple choice, time-based, questions based around clips, stills and storylines from the '70s to the current incarnation
6 categories of question: Families, workplace, romance, the Woolpack, feuds and friendship
'Superfan' section to test the real addicts!

Contents:
DVD Game
12 'Bar Quiz' Style Beer Mats
67386.name: Emmerdale DVD Game

67388.name: Original Scala
67388.description:
From the back of the Box (translated from German):

An exciting puzzle game for 2 to 4 players. The players try place down five of their own pieces in a row, while preventing the other players from doing the same.

67389.name: Joker Clown
67389.description: Joker Clown is a memory variant by Milton Bradley Games. Instead of looking for pairs withing the laid out tiles, players are trying to memorize the tiles and match them with a tile on their hand.

67390.name: Hakkefuda
67390.description:
Ｈａｋｋｅfuda is a Japanese game based on the Yi Jing (I Ching) Ba Gua (Pa Kua) figures.

The box contains 139 cards total and includes a deck of 8x8 trigrams and all 64 hexgrams of the Yi Jing series. Each deck includes two blank cards. There are seven reference cards included for the games playable with the two decks. A small gameboard is included.

From the back of the box, translated from Japanese:

'Hakkefuda is a set of original game cards that takes for its motif the eight trigrams (Gua) used in fortune telling and Feng Shui. It is possible to play several card and Hanafuda style games.

"Gua" were invented in Ancient China, representing all things and phenomena through the two fundamental ideas of yin and yang, one could say they are the first digital inscriptions. The Ba Gua represent the fundamental attributes of all things through three yin-yang lines: they represent "heaven", "earth", "thunder", "wind", "water", "fire", "mountain", and "spring".'

The box contains rules for three games, entitled "Taikoubou" (太公望 - The Great Duke's Hope), "Houshinhakkejin"(封神八卦陣 - Signet God Ba Gua Formation), and "Hakkaken"(八卦剣 - Ba Gua Sword)

67391.name: La Mangoranii
67391.description:
User Summary:

The second Anashiva Reahna book describes the Mangoranii province, in the southern part of the Ney-dora empire, and its capital city, Mangor.

The book features descriptions of the Mangoranii geography, its history, the day-to-day life of its inhabitants the Mangoranenii, their laws, customs and religious beliefs. Included is a 60x60cm map of the province.

The book ends with a long scenario set in Mangoranii, "Le Faux Prophète".

67392.name: Ecran
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67392.description:
User Summary:

The gamemaster screen contains a 4 panels screen and a 16 pages book with a three parts scenario for angels, which starts as an haunted house investigation and ends with a confrontation with an apocalyptic cult.

67400.name: Escape from Innsmouth (1st Edition)
67400.description:
From the back of the book:

"Innsmouth was once a prosperous trading town located on the north coast of Massachusetts. Early in the 19th century her great sailing ships traveled the world in search of trace and treasure.

A series of mishaps brought the town to the brink of financial ruin, but it was saved when Captain Obed Marsh discovered a secret source of gold among the islands of the South Pacific. Prosperity returned to Innsmouth, but only for a short time. The gold held a price that now, nearly a century later, has left the town a decaying hulk, its diseased citizenry mere shambling parodies of what were once people. Shunned by it's neigbours, Innsmouth slowly dies."

67401.name: World's Greatest Villain
67401.description:
So, you want to be a villain? The best? In Century City, it's not so easy. You've got to gain reputation, find gear, and plot nefarious schemes. Note of warning, though – trust no one. Villains don't share, and a host of others will stand in your way. Overcome these obstacles, though, and you can establish yourself as the greatest criminal mind of all time!

World's Greatest Villain is a fast-paced, competitive card game. Collect and equip gear, complete schemes, sabotage your opponents as you gain reputation, all so you can establish yourself as the top in your profession.

World's Greatest Villain is designed for 3-6 players, ages 12 and up.

67402.name: Lure of the Expanse
rpgpodcastepisode: D6G Ep 56: Rogue Trader: Into the Storm Interview, Dresden RPG Interview, Catacombs Detailed Review
67402.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You are a Rogue Trader, an explorer with a sacred mandate to venture beyond the limits of the Imperium in the name of the Emperor. Whether you live the life of an outlaw privateer, or as a scion of an ancient noble line, as a Rogue Trader you have the power and the tools to challenge all rivals for supreme control of the riches lurking in the uncharted reaches of space.

Now, you can bring the light of the Emperor to the darkest corners of the Koronus Expanse. Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce the upcoming sourcebook for Rogue Trader, Lure of the Expanse!

Lure of the Expanse features three adventures set amongst the unexplored stars beyond the Imperium. Wealth and glory await those with the courage to venture into the farthest reaches of space.

In Eye of the Needle, your Explorers will travel to the perilous port of Footfall to learn of a dark prophecy of long-lost riches. In The Heathen Trail, the Explorers find themselves on the path of uncountable riches... but they must cross the wild tracts of the Heathen Stars. Threats abound, but can the Explorers transform danger into rewards? Finally, in The World Beyond, the Explorers discover the location of the legendary treasure world. Now, can they prevail against a host of enemies?

67403.name: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
rpgissuearticle: Mon beau navire, ô ma mémoire
Thérèse a le feu au cul
Un Jour Viendra Où Les Schtroumpfs Seront Les Maîtres Du Monde
67403.description:
User Summary:

The first edition of In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas is a box set containing 3 books.

The first book is dedicated to the Forces of Good: rules, character creation, archangels, powers and limitations, human NPCs (Soldiers of God, priests, churches...)

The second book has the same structure as the first, and describes the Forces of Evil.

The third book features 8 scenarios (4 for each faction).

67406.name: Professor Noggin's Wonders of the World
67406.description:
Professor Noggin's 34th education card game teaches children ages 7 and up about awe inspiring landmarks from different cultures and different times. Game comes with 30 cards, one die, and instructions.

List of card topics include skyscrapers, dams, bridges, seven wonders of the ancient world, pyramids, monuments, and more.

67407.description:
User Summary

The Handbag of Holding was a promotional item originally given away by Steve Jackson Games during the August 2009 Gen Con in Indianapolis. It was reprinted in February 2012 and given away to people who spent $75 or more at the publisher's online store. Starting on March 6th, 2012 it briefly became available for purchase at the online store. So what had once been a highly collectible item due to its rarity, was now just another piece of Munchkin merchandise.

The handbag is a standard handbag, colored pink and with a picture of the Sparkly Good Fairy from the Munchkin Fairy Dust booster pack. As a handbag, it's nothing exceptional, but it also comes with a special rule for use in any Munchkin card game that includes the Munchkin Fairy Dust expansion. The rule allows you to take a card from the Fairy Dust deck's discard pile, once per game (see the corresponding board game version for details).

Part of the Munchkin series
67407.name: Munchkin Fairy Dust Handbag Of Holding

67409.name: All About Raleigh, North Carolina
67409.description: Like other "All About Town" game, learn all about Raleigh, North Carolina (in 1982) with this "Exciting, Fast Moving Game for the Entire Family." The largish 6-piece board shows the major streets of downtown with businesses at the appropriate locations. The object is to travel on the playing board to the shopping locations shown on your Shopping List.

67410.description:
In November 3067 the Second Star League disbanded. The Word of Blake - a splinter group of ComStar - had been on the verge of joining in fulfillment of ancient prophecies. Denied their dream, the Blakists sought to preserve the Star League against the follies of the Houses, but its fanaticism manifested this noble goal as the Jihad: a horrific war that has pitted every faction against each other and even themselves. Against such an anvil, new cutting edge machines of war are marched into the fire. The discovery of an ancient Hegemony Memory Core graphically showcases the desperation of the conflict, as primitive 'Mechs not seen on a battlefield since the dawn of 'Mech production over half a millennia ago once again appear.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3075 provides a comprehensive look at the latest machines of war debuting during the Jihad: from 'Mechs to battle armor, Support Vehicles to DropShips and more. In addition, a complete "Age of War" section covers the Terran Hegemony and each of the five Great Houses during the Age of War, including the very first BattleMechs produced by each faction and how such machines are starting to appear once more. Each military vehicle is illustrated in detail, accompanied by a description of its history, capabilities, game stats, and some of the unit's most famous pilots.
67410.name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout 3075

67411.name: Level II
67411.description:
Level II is a fast paced skirmish miniatures game, set in the future.
In the year 2222 mankind manages to devastate their home planet.
Nuclear fusion as well as manipulation of genes have become daily buisiness in this harsh world ruled by corporate groups.
Journeys to Mars have become possible and science is about to find a way to travel to the stars.

One of Level II's biggest strengths is, that it consists of a ruleset only. No miniatures come with this game!
This way a player may pick any of his miniatures and calculate their point costs referring to the extremely well elaborated and very fine tuned equipment list.
There are rules for about everything that has ever set it's metal or plastic foot on a futuristic war-torn gametable:
Humans, aliens, different kinds of humanoids, tough races, weak races, robots, androids, crafts, cannons, artillery, sabotage, special ammunition, cybernetics - everything you could wish for.
Even the equipment table basically covers everything "out there" - maybe you'll have to substitute sometimes some weapons (like a boltpistol with a common pistol), but you will be able to work with everything that you might find in the hands or at the belt of your miniature.

The rulebook covers the basic rules as well as experts' rules and campaign rules.

Even though Level II is designed for small scale skirmishes with only a couple of individual fighters per side, the rules don't prevent you from playing large scale combats as well.
In that case however players should have only a few different troop types, to keep combat simple.
For example on the one hand you could get about 50 - 100 light weighted fighters for 1000 points, but if you really spice them up, you may field less than 10 tough guys for the same value, too.

Level II uses an unique command system:
The army of a player is divided into several groups (one at least!) consisting of a number of fighters depending on the faction they are fighting for.
Each group gets one command (e.g. "advance"), represented by a chit placed at that group's position. Depending on that command, each fighter of that group may take up to two different actions (mostly moving + something different, like e.g. taking aim).
In order to change that command, certain conditions have to be met (roll versus a certain value with modifiers according to circumstances like e.g. groupleader killed or minimum distance not met) - if the roll fails the command is either changed later or even not at all.
Specialits may act according to their specialities whenever the player sees fit.

Level II plays very realistically: Most weapons kill an unarmoured human with one hit - just as in real life. This way you will have to be very careful with about everything:
How are you going to spend your points?
Where and (even mor important:) how are you going to move your fighters?
This way, Level II is a very tactical skirmish game where the skill and the experience of a player garantee a victory instead of lucky dierolls.

67412.name: Shadis (Issue 21 - Oct 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Flag Bridge: Sailing the Waters of Play-By-Mail Games
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
67412.description:
Volume 4, No. 3

From the table of contents:

Special Features


Role Call - Peering under the shrinkwrap of new products. Soon to be a recurring column
Armies on the March - Spicing up combat 52 ways, part II
The Importance of Family Clans - Part two of two: tables for clan management
Code of the Rats - How to weld a party together in the first place
Feature Review: Goldtree Engine and Kingspoint - IBM-based GM's aid


Gamemaster's Workshop


Hook, Line and Sinker - Adventures on the Fly
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Generic non-player characters ready for action


Regular Departments


Cries from the Attic - Editorial of a Madman
Mail Bag
Up My Sleeve - The world of card games
New Perspectives - The world of miniatures
Flag Bridge - Our special play-by-mail section
Market Platz - Classified, announcements, conventions, etc.


Comics


Stick Figure Theatre - Chris Avellone is apparently still at large from Happy View, as this cartoon shows
Joe Genero - Joe heaves. ...No, a rock
Finieous Fingers - Black hole fun!
Knights of the Dinner Table - An unprecedented two-page episode

67413.name: Bible Wonders
67413.description:
From the front of the box: "The game of memory & morals."

Memory: The object of the game is to collect six gold coins. You travel around the board on one of six different roads. Movement occurs after turning over a picture that matches the picture next to the next space on the road. Each road is three pictures long and ends at an inn where you collect the gold coin. You may then choose to move to whichever road you want to travel next.

Morals: The pictures next to the roads show the consequences of 18 of Christ's miracles. The pictures that you turn over to match with them are the same scenes before the miracle occurred. The rules also contain a short story of "Malek's Journey" wherein he learns the secret of great wealth.

The game comes with instructions, a game board, 6 "Malek" sandal pieces, 6 flat leather purses on which you lay the coins, 18 match pictures, and 42 cardboard coins (6 coins in 7 colors).

67414.name: Shadis (Issue 22 - Dec 1995)
rpgissuearticle: And the Devil Will Drag You Under
Flag Bridge: Sailing the Waters of Play-By-Mail Games
New Perspectives - Silent Death: the Next Millenium
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
To Do What We Must: A Passionate Defense
What's On the Table Besides Dice
67414.description:
Volume 4, No. 4

From the table of contents:

Pull-Out Section


The Ultimate Card List - More pages of card game lists than you could shake a stick at


Feature Articles


What's On the Table Besides Dice - The uses of props in tabletop RPGs
Medieval Credit Cards - Gems throughout history
Space Iguanas Uber Alles - Converting Harry Turtledove's Worldwar series into a role-playing setting
Nexus Park - Tell your player it'll just be "a walk in the park"
And the Devil Will Drag You Under - You thought your troubles would be over when you got rich and famous?
The Dread Forest Biyll- A nasty little fantasy ecosystem
Character for Characters - Get some!
To Do What We Must - At least he's chosen a system which uses dice this time
Role-Playing the Romantic Heroine - Three-dimensional NPC women - what a concept!


From the Gamemaster's Forge


The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly - Generic non-player characters ready for action


Regular Departments


Editorial - "Hi! My Name Is..."
Real Spies - Spies for the Holidays. Our final Real Spies column
New Perspectives - The world of miniatures
Flag Bridge - Our special play-by-mail section


Comics


Stick Figure Theatre - Chris's Top Ten things to do at game conventions

67415.name: Evil Unleashed
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES...
WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
67415.description:
From the back cover:

Evil Within Your Grasp

As every Champions fan knows, you can never have too many great villain! But with so many Champions books in print, sometimes it's hard to find just the villain you're looking for without a lot of page-flipping.

That's where Evil Unleashed comes in. It saves you the effort of carrying a lot of books to the gaming table and the time needed to look through them for the particular villain you want. It collects the villains from nearly a dozen supplements --


Champions
Champions Battlegrounds
Champions Universe
Millennium City
Sharper than a Serpent's Tooth
the Ultimate series
Until
Vibora Bay
Villainy Amok


and puts them between two covers so you only have to refer to one book when you're searching for a superpowered bad guy. And for a little added fiendishness Evil Unleashed includes five all-new villains: the supervillain team Mech-Force 1; the mysterious demonsouled supermage Josiah Brimstone; and Vixen, a swift and seductive cat burglar with other goals on her mind than just robbery.

So you'd better make sure your heroes out on patrol tonight keep their eyes open! Some evil's about to be unleashed on your campaign...

67416.name: Wondrous Items of Power
67416.description:
From the back cover:

Wondrous Items of Power is a d20 System product detailing a variety of items with startling magical powers. Marvelous stories and background information make each of these wondrous items far more than simple treasure, but the basis for entire adventures or campaigns, aided by stats for the people, places and monsters that own or protect them.

67417.name: Cloud Warriors
67417.description:
From the Back Cover:

The Sky's the Limit!

Take to the Skies!
To a ground-bound warrior, there is nothing more deadly than an opponent who can take to the air, be it on a magic carpet or on the back of a wyvern. Nut now it's your turn! Take to the skies and bring the fight to them! Tame a pegasus, or just grab your favorite lance, jump on the back of a dragon and level the playing field for once!

Rise High Above the Clouds...
Who lives above the clouds, looking down upon the lands as the gods from above? Some sought a reprieve from the wards far below while others are looking only for a new realm to conquer. But those who were born and bred in the air will not give up their airborne kingdoms... At least without a fight!

Your Adventure Just Took on a Whole New Dimension!
There's more in the skies than just the dragons and the odd flying wizard. Entire societies, each with their own dark secrets, live on without ever setting foot on the ground miles below. Some are good, clinging to the light, while others plot the vile destruction of all who would oppose their rule. do you have the courage to face them in their own element?

67418.name: Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe: 1989 Character Updates
67418.description:
From the Back Cover:

"The Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe is the complete last word on heroes, villains, and other characters of the Marvel Universe that players of the Marvel Super Heroes role-playing game have been looking for! Supplemented by data from the popular Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe, the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe has complete Marvel Super Heroes game statistics for hundreds of Marvel characters - the good, the bad and the in-between!

The pages of the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe are designed to be removed from the book for easy play. The pages are five hole punched so they can be organized in a binder. And each page includes complete background information, important facts, and complete stats - everything you need!

And the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe contains over 100 first-rate portraits of your favorite heroes and villains - including many pieces commissioned especially for this book and never seen before!

This fifth volume of the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe covers updates on familiar characters who have changed (such as the Thing and Madelyne Pryor) and new characters who appeared in 1989 (such as Chameleon and Tombstone). Look for the first four volumes in your local stores, and watch for further updates in the years ahead!"

67419.name: Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe: 1990 Character Update
67419.description:
From the Back Cover:

"The Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe is the complete last word on heroes, villains, and other characters of the Marvel Universe that players of the Marvel Super Heroes role-playing game have been looking for! Supplemented by data from the popular Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe, the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe has complete Marvel Super Heroes game statistics for hundreds of Marvel characters - the good, the bad and the in-between!

The pages of the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe are designed to be removed from the book for easy play. The pages are five hole punched so they can be organized in a binder. And each page includes complete background information, important facts, and complete stats - everything you need!

And the Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe covers updates on familiar characters who have changed (such as the Moon Knight and the Hobgoblin) and new characters who appeared in 1990 (such as Roughhouse and Bloodscream). Look for the first four volumes and the 1989 Update in your local stores, and watch for further updates in the years ahead!"

67421.name: ASG Golf
67421.description:
The ASG Golf Game is actually two games: a full shot-by-shot version and a Quick Play version. Each golfer is represented by his own card, which recreates his abilities, highlighting his strengths and weaknesses. The same golfer cards are used in both versions of the ASG game. Each course is drawn to scale by George Gerney, who has been analyzing and drawing courses for over 10 years. They are rendered in vivid color and are like an oversized yardage book. Each hole of every Quick Play course has its own card. In addition to the result numbers, each card features a small full-color drawing of each hole. We trust you will find ASG Golf to be a well thought out, challenging, and fun golfing experience.

Source: asggames.com website

67422.name: Spies&Spooks: The Cold War Edition
67422.description:
Set in the 1980's, Spies&Spooks is a spy-themed strategy card game in which each player secretly assumes the role of one of eight spy characters. Each player also receives one of eight coded Assignments, which is decoded in the spy's Passport. The combination of the Secret Assignment with the Secret Identity determines how each player can win the game.
Secret Assignments are to gather specific Secret Cards (ie. Missile Secrets, Political Secrets, Computer Secrets, Trade Secrets etc) and smuggle them out of each game by combining them with various Smuggle Cards (Dead Drop, Diplomatic Pouch, Radio Transmission). Assignments carry varying rewards based upon their difficulty.
Depending on their Secret Identity traits, spies may also steal cards from each other, set bombs as traps, kill each other with Dagger Cards, expose other spies identities and/or assignments, or place them in detention in attempting to be the first spy to complete his or her Secret Mission.
Due to the many various combinations of Identities with Assignments, the game is constantly presenting new and different possibilities for players and has great replay value.
A player wins the game by being the first spy to complete his or her Secret Mission. Multiple hands can be played successively, constituting the Great Game.
Source: Publisher Statement

67423.name: Werewolf: The Apocalypse: Storyteller's Screen (1st Edition)
67423.description:
User summary:

A three panel foldout screen. The outside panels contain character creation summaries, while the inside includes game reference mechanics for shapechanging, combat maneuvers, weapons, difficulty, the gauntlet and more.

Also included is a foldout sheet with new gifts and extra rules covering spirits.

67425.name: Dogs of WAR
67425.description: (From the publisher blurb): DOGS OF W*A*R - The Real Man's Role Playing Game! Using the rules first seen in the fantastic Barbarians of Lemuria, this great new role playing game gives you the covert adventure and gung-ho thrills of men's action adventure novels of the 70's and 80's. Dogs of W*A*R allows you to create an experienced character ready to play in minutes and straightforward rules that don't get in the way of role playing. DOGS OF W*A*R - All action...all danger...all guts!

67426.description:
Press Release:
Expected release: July 2010 - Date subject to change.

Voltron: Defender of the Universe battle game includes everything two players need to stage epic battles between the forces of Voltron and the Galaxy Alliance and Prince Lotor and his robeast Lo-tron of the fiendish Drule Empire.

Includes 22 pre-painted plastic figures, including Voltron, 5 Voltron Lions, 5 Galaxy Garrison Cruisers, Lo-Tron, 1 Prince Lotor’s Command Ship, 4 Robeasts, and 5 Lo-Tron Force Skull Ships. The game will also include 1 double-sided play mat, 24 specialty dice, 4 status counters, and a full-color rulebook. Completely compatible with all current Monsterpocalypse series.

--
Kakaris Maelstrom adds:
Voltron: Defender of the Universe is a standalone game in the Monsterpocalypse game world, targeted at gamers who were hoping to see more "name brand" monsters in the game. The Voltron box offers players an excellent (and complete) way to get into the game but with some characters you're likely already familiar with. The game is also fully compatiable with other Monsterpocalypse miniatures and maps, so you'll no doubt start to see Terra Kahn vs. Voltron and such.

Voltron (and his nemesis Lo-Tron) are morphers, a type of monster whose Alpha form is made up of a series of unit-sized pieces. Voltron is unique in that previous morpher's Alpha forms were made up of 4 units, whereas Voltron and Lo-Tron are both 5 units. In addition, the battles are fought in space rather than on a traditional Monsterpocalypse city block.

Monsterpocalypse is a unexpectedly strategic CMG. Based in the world of kaiju (loosely translated from Japanese as ‘giant monster’), you'll control a monster and a legion of support units. You'll vie for control of critical board positions as you try to optimize your die pools. Then unleash your fury against your opponent's monster using a variety of power attacks, destroying a city block or two along the way.
67426.name: Monsterpocalypse: Voltron – Defender of the Universe Battle Game

67427.name: Arkona
rpgissuearticle: „Daj, ać ja  pobruszę, a ty  poczywaj”
67427.description:
User Summary:

This is the first and yet the only handbook published for the Polish roleplaying game Arkona. It contains all the rules needed to play and the world's presentation.
Authors claimed to publish expansions to Arkona, but it never happened.

67428.name: Pyramid (Issue 16 - Nov 1995)
67428.description:
Contents

Origins Report
GenCon Report
Our World Travels
Trespasser's Isle by Graeme Davis
The Tyrants (by Stephen Dedman)
Kier-E-Keth & Papa Fish by Chris McCubbin
INWO Sprich Deutsch
GURPS Greece Designer's Notes by Jon F. Zeigler
Cycles, Spikes & Stuff by David L. Pulver
Pyramid Picks

67429.description:
From Haba Website:

Roll the die then look for the corresponding shape or color and place it on the game board... and all at once flowers and butterflies will gleam. 2 die games for 1-3 players age 2+. Available with English packaging.
Age: from 2yrs
This game stimulates:

Learning to Understand Rules
Precise Motor Functions
Free Play
Recognizing and Naming Colors and Shapes
67429.name: Farben & Formen
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series

67430.name: Feeling & Touching
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
67430.description:
From Haba's Website:

Various activities about feeling and touching: the beautiful, easy to grasp wooden pieces stimulate free play and foster fine motor skills. The two tactile games introduce first games with rules. A game collection for 1 - 2 players ages 2+.

67431.name: Memo-Construction Site
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
67431.description:
From Haba Website:
The fabric cards are great to hold and won't wrinkle! A picture and memory game for the smallest with 24 pieces made of cotton/polyester, washable.

Size of card approx. 8,5 x 8,5 cm, height 5 mm.

A game with powerful machines for 1 - 4 players ages 2+.

67432.name: Babylon: Gateway of the Gods
67432.description:
Epic building in the magnificent city of Babylon.

Players, as nobles of the city, begin with a small pool of Workers, which they assign to a variety of roles in order to earn silver Talents and prestige. They compete with one another to contribute the most resources toward building Babylon's great works, such as the Hanging Gardens and the Ishtar Gate. To do so they will need to expand their pool of Workers, construct Buildings that make more efficient use of their Resources, arrange Caravan and Shipping expeditions to bring goods back to the city, and deal with the Events that befall the lands.

The game includes:
Game Board
80 Worker markers (12 in each player color)
80 Contributor markers (20 in each player color)
4 Player Tableaus
8 Boats
8 Camels
various Resource chips
40 Event Cards
100 silver Talents

67435.name: Drachenerbe
67435.description:
(translated from the back of the book)
The heroes have not been able to translate the Birscha scroll found in part I. There is only one possibilty left: To mount an expedition in the montains called Das Eherne Schwert, the highest mountains found in Aventurien, that no mortal has braved in its entirety. Because the Elder Dragon Fuldigor nests here, and he alone might provide answers. And so the heroes walk in the path of Niobara of Anchopal, legendary student of Rohal the Wise himself. Can this expedition succeed? Or does the enemy not hesitate to unleash the ancient knowledge of the trolls to annihilate the heroes?

This is part 2 of Die Drachenchronik series.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Årets Spil Best Family Game Winner
2011 Golden GeekBest Children's Board Game Nominee
2011/2012 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Children's Game Nominee
67436.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Players in Hogwarts must navigate the castle's shifting staircases and secret passages – something in the book and movie that's represented in the game by small square path pieces that can change their locations in a central grid. To win, players need to collect the homework from their classes and return to the common area.
67436.name: Harry Potter Hogwarts

67437.name: Band on the Run
67437.description:
From the back of the adventure:

"Someone wants to put an old rock band back together, easy right?

Wrong!

What should be a simple investigative case has the characters scouring the Conurbation, the deregulated zone, the Amazon rainforest and the Gobi Desert.

Daring Tales of the Sprawl: Band on the Run pits the heroes against kidnappers, eco-terrorists and a biker gang, not to mention pitching them into the midst of a corporate war!"

67438.name: The Black Guardian
rpgseries: Daring Tales of the Space Lanes
67438.description:
From the back of the adventure:

"The Black Guardians: The heroes must wrest an ancient alien relic from the grasp of a dangerous crime lord, but this is only the beginning of their problems as the artifact is either the means to save a world or condemn it forever! Plus there are several others who wish to get their claws on it, as well!

Freedom fighters, an old enemy and new allies await the adventurers in the dry deserts of Gator."

67439.name: Deadly Double
67439.description:
A simple dice game with two special dice and depending on the symbols or numbers rolled you add another ante, get part of or the whole jackpot.

Famous for the ad for the game as hint for a conspiracy theory. The ad shows, among others, the numbers 12 and 7 and talks about peoples in airraid shelters, November 1941. This led to a FBI investigation if it was a secret code by the Japanes Intelligence agency for the attack on Pearl Harbour to warn their agents in the US.
The investigation led to a negative result, but the fame of the game stayed.

67440.name: Web of Deceit
67440.description:
From the back of the adventure:

"DON'T GET CAUGHT IN THIS TANGLED WEB OF DECEIT!

A strange shadow has fallen over the normally quiet village of Rushton. The villagers have been acting strangely, with some disappearing for days at a time and a few families missing entirely!

Behind these strange occurrences is an unearthly creature, part-human and part-spider. This creatures venom enslaves the weak minded and the it plans to enslave the whole of Rushton and beyond!

Can the heroes defeat this malevolent evil? In Web of Deceit the heroes will be fully tested in this exciting adventure for Hellfrost!"

67441.name: Super 3 Game Box
67441.description: 3 simple games for children come in 1 box: Jet Squadron, Rockets around the Moon and Uranium. The game play is nothing but roll and move but the graphic presentation is appealing.

67442.name: Pyramid (Issue 17 - Jan 1996)

67443.name: Feed the Elephant
67443.description: Early 1950's game of flicking peanuts into an elephant's mouth. First player to 12 wins.

67444.name: Féerie
67444.description:
User Summary:

The Féerie box set contains:

- 3 books: "Création de personnage" contains the character creation rules (including description of races and classes), a short explanation of the rules and an equipment list, "Règles de Simulation" contains the rules (including combat and experience), a list of magic items, and advice to the gamemaster, "Description des Talents" is a list of skills with detailed explanations.

- 6 booklets with spell lists (one for each class)

- a black and white gamemaster screen

- 6 cardboard sheets with monster description (4 monsters per sheet)

- a scenario booklet with 2 scenarios and a double page of player aids

- 3 cardboard sheets of floor plans

- a sheet of cardboard figures

- a "simulation disk", a small cardboard disk with spell modifiers on one side, and damage per strength points on the other.

67445.name: Pyramid (Issue 18 - Mar 1996)
67445.description:

First Contact by Scott Tengelin
Twist the Knife by Steve Jackson
Die Hard 1872 by Lise Breakey
Pyramid Preview: Mythos by Derek Pearcy
Pyramid Picks

Once Upon A Time
Kult

Secret Societies
Settlers of Catan
Legends of the Five Rings
Total Attack Soccer
Tactical Command

The Five Treasures of Ragathar by Scott Tengelin

67446.name: Périple en Amodan
67446.description:
The third Anashiva Reahna describes the Amodan continent, under attack by the Ney-Dora empire.

The book contains a description of Amodanii history and geopgraphy, economy and politics, chapters about the capital city of Rupellaem, Amodanii religions, Amodanii legends and mysterious places, an Amodanii lexicon and 2 scenarios.

The book comes with a 40x30cm map of Amodan.

67447.name: Questions pour un Empire
67447.description:
User Summary:

This sourcebook for Empire & Dynasties reveals the big mysteries of the game world. It is intended to be read only by gamemasters.

There are chapters about the origins of the Ney-Dora empire, the emperor, Ney-Dora, the Navigator Guild and the Hu-Llivanii, the Xu-Sheanan emissary, and a chronology of the evolution of the empire between 5800 and 6000, including informations about new technologies, such as the xalax chariots.

67448.name: No Quarter (Issue 1 - Jul 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Fire in the Hole! - No Quarter
Guts & Gears - Iron Fangs and Ironclad
Modeling and Painting - Harbinger of Menoth and Karchev the Terrible
Pistols at Dawn: Duels in the Iron Kingdoms
The Gathering Storm: Creating Our own Apotheosis
67448.description:
From the publisher's website:
The debut issue! No Quarter #1 looks at mercenary contracts for WARMACHINE, pistols and duleing in the Iron Kingdoms, and a story featuring two sisters at odds: Haley and Denegrah.

Cover Art "Second Wave" by Brian Despain

ISSN: 7558200190

67449.name: À vous de jouer
67449.description: French cycling themed game that was published for ProTour team Caisse d'épargne. In this game that is played on the beach the players first draw a track in the sand. Then they use a sort of marble that is flicked in a similar way as the famous Carabande game. The marble determines the positing of the cyclists (pawns). He who reaches the finish first wins.

67450.name: Financial City
67450.description:
Financial City is a game made up to increase your knowladge in areas such as the Stock Market, Real Estate, Business. By playing the game, you will experience different situations from real life and you will increase your decision making skills related to income increase. Financial City is for players 14 and up and can be played by up to 8 players. Every player will receive an expenses keeping file. Every player will pick a card from the Jobs category. On each of the cards one will find the profession (specialty), the salary and the monthly expenses. At the beginning of the game every player will receive a sum of money equal to the double of the salary.

From the publishers' website.

67453.description:
On an icy lake, two clans of prehistoric men clash in a match of Kairn, better known as Caveman Curling, this being an ancestor to the modern sport of curling. Players compete as individuals or are grouped into two clans, and they try to land their stones the closest to a target each round. On a player's turn he takes two actions:

• He launches a stone across the ice, flicking it with his finger toward the target on the other end of the game board.

• To improve the positioning of his stone or the chances of it staying in place, he can choose to use either a small or large hammer or a totem. With a hammer, the player moves the stone according to the size of the hammer. As for the totem, the player sets it on top of the stone; if the totem falls off the stone, the player can shoot it again on a later turn.

If your player or clan has one or more stones closer to the center of the target than the other clan, you score points. The first player/clan to collect six points wins.

A note about the different editions.

Caveman Curling (2012)
Kairn (2010)

There are significant production differences between Kairn and Caveman Curling, though the game play is almost identical between the two versions. Kairn (200 copies) was designed and self-published by Daniel Quodbach in 2010. Blackrock Editions and Scorpion Masque produced 1000 copies of Kairn and released it at Essen in 2011. Gryphon Games version of the game has yet to be produced, pending the conclusion of a current Kickstarter campaign that was organized to gauge demand for its version. Caveman Curling is scheduled for mass production in January, 2012, and to be released in late February, 2012. The first and only production copy of the Gryphon version will arrive in the US on December 14, 2011 and a video will be made showing the differences between Kairn and Caveman Curling.
67453.name: Caveman Curling
boardgameexpansion: Caveman Curling: The Black Sheep of the Clan

67454.description:
Hex hex Flume is a very simple game for two players, played on a hex hex board lined with a perimeter of green stones (or green, stone-sized stickers). Two players, Red and Blue, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board.

If you add a stone which forms 5 or 6 connections (adjacencies) with neighboring stones of any color (red, blue or green) you must add another stone to the board while it's still your turn. And so on. Your turn concludes when you add a stone which forms 4 or less connections with neighboring stones.

Certain move types are prohibited in hex hex Flume, unlike its sister game, square Flume, in which there are no prohibited move types.

The object is to have the majority of stones on the board.
67454.name: Flume (hex hex)

67455.name: Californiaopoly
67455.description: California Monopoly with an extremely colorful game board. Includes: Deck of Fate Cards, Deck of Property Cards, 6 Playing Pieces, 15 Skyscrapers, 15 Redding Bungalows, 15 Eureka Bungalows, 2 Dice & Play Money.

67456.name: Plumb Crazy
67456.description:
Simple spin and move game with a cool 3D spinner.

Contents:

BIG 15 X 15 Game Board
4 Friendly Plumber Game Pieces
Swing Around Spinner

67457.name: Blood Fury
67457.description:
From the back cover:

When an innocent woman is injured during one of their battles, the heroes find themselves involved in the search for a blood donor with the same rare, mutant blood type. As the time left to save her life slips by, the heroes find themselves drawn into a web of intrigue and danger in which the lives of hundreds of thousands may be caught, and at the center of which lurks a familiar but deadly menace.

Blood Fury is a race against time usable either with Champions or Dark Champions.

67458.name: Red Dwarf: A.I. Screen
67458.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

"I've got the RPG, but my players keep sneaking peeks at my dice and game notes!" Don't worry, mate. We've got your back. Introducing the Red Dwarf A.I. Screen. A six-panel cardstock referee screen crammed with handy stats and information for the AI on the go. It comes with a 24-page booklet full of extra bits (one of the reasons it's called the Extra Bits Book) like new character types, NPCs, adventure seeds, an alternate setting, kewl gear and tables for generating Horrible Creatures and Very Important Items. Best of all, players can't see the destruction and mayhem coming their way. Just like it should be.

8.5" x 11", 6-panel tri-fold cardstock game screen. Full color exterior, b&w interior. 24-page Extra Bits Book.

67460.name: Silver Age Sentinels Character Folio
rpg: Silver Age Sentinels: The Superhero Role-Playing Game
67460.description:
From the back of the book:

Your superheroes can't be expected to keep all their notes on random pieces of paper. They deserve their own Character Folio!

This is the ultimate Silver Age Sentinels character sheet and player bookkeeping tool.

67461.name: Pyramid (Issue 20 - Jul 1996)

67463.name: Battle Royale II
67463.description:
Card game base on the move Battle Royale II. It follows Battle Royal.
Players are students and try to kill each other. The last one standing wins the game.

There are terrorist cards placed in the middle of the board. Players have a team of student-cards. Each team tries with different weapon cards to destroy their opponents or the terrorists. The weapon cards are held in the hand. A player which loses all of his/her student-cards loses the game.

67464.name: No Quarter (Issue 2 - Sep 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Foundry, Forge, & Crucible - The Order of Illumination
Guts & Gears - Long Gunners and Redeemer
Inside the Secret War: The Order of Illumination
Modeling and Painting - Behemoth and Deathjack
The Battle in the Thornewood Scenarios
The Pendrake Encounters - Pendrake in the Rimeshaws
67464.description:
From website:

No Quarter #2 introduces two new mercenary warcasters to WARMACHINES, an inside look at the Order of Illumination, and the dangerous, if lucrative, business of cortex smuggling in the Iron Kingdoms.

Cover Art "Wraith Witch Deneghra" by Matt Wilson

ISSN: 7558200191

67465.name: The World of Tales from the Crypt
rpgsetting: The World of Tales from the Crypt
67465.description:
From the back of the book

Welcome, kiddies, to my cozy Crypt. Have I got a story for you! It's time for another terror tale from your old pal, the Cryptkeeper — only this one stars you and your fiendish friends! It's a sickening little saga that promises to plunge you into malice, madness, murder and mayhem! So take a seat, boils and ghouls, the show's about to start... the credits are rolling... and it's curtains for you! Hehehehehehe!
From out of the Cryptkeeper's "die-brary" comes a roleplaying game guaranteed to provide frightseekers with twisted tales, sickening stabs at suspense, and chucnks of chilling charnel chatter. The Cryptkeeper is looking for someone to play with, so he's sending you and your players spiraling into a world of blood curdling horror, in search of sinister secrets, murderous mysteries, artifacts too awful to name, and the answers to his own "cryptic" riddles. The rules of his little game are simple: win... or die.

His players are people with dark secrets, hidden fears, and here and there a hint of madness. Dropped into strange settings (and sometimes other bodies), they must confront countless horrors, all the while at the mercy of the Cryptkeeper ... and the Cryptkeeper has no mercy.

Included in this WorldBook are tips on designing and running Tales from the Crypt adventures and campaigns, new background options, new skills, source material on the terrifying little town of Gainesford, adventure hooks, character templates, and a mini-adventure, "Circus of Souls".

You must have MasterBook to play this game.

67466.name: Skull
67466.description:
Post apocalyptic football game.
Based on the movie 'The Blood of Heroes'.

The aim of the game is to get a 'dogskull' onto a spike at the opposing end of the field while preventing the opposing team from doing the same.

The team of each player may choose between:
Runner: The only piece allowed to touch the skull and score points. (mandatory)
Chain: The piece with the greatest reach on the field and strong damage.
Pole: Fighting piece able to block front field spaces.
Net: Catch enemy pieces
Hook: Pin enemy pieces

Cards are used for movement and to determine the outcome of fights.

The game comes in a video cassette box, with board, tokens and cards.

67468.name: Les Voiles du Destin
67468.description:
User Summary:

This sourcebook for Bloodlust adds major elements to the game background. As such, it is advised that players read the book only after playing the scenarios.

Les Voiles du Destin explains what are the God Weapons and introduces a new threat to the Tanaephis continent. The book contains a summary of the "Eclat de Lune" campaign, two scenarios ("Les navigateurs n'ont pas abattu toutes leurs cartes" and "Eaux dormantes") to introduce the new background elements, a detailed description of the new villains, new rules and five other scenarios.

67470.name: La Méthode du Docteur Chestel
67470.description:
User Summary:

The rulebook contains everything needed to play. After a short introduction to roleplaying games, Mask creation is explained (the Mask is the avatar players use for entering the patient's Intracos). The next chapters introduce the rules, including wounds (and healing), the experience system and the different powers available to the players in the Intracos. The rest of the book contains gamemaster aids (information about the impact on the patient of violence in the Intracos, how to play NPCs, tips on setting the proper atmosphere during the game session), scenario ideas (curing phobias, finding vital information in the Intracos of a criminal, dealing with the split personality disorder of a D&D player...)

The book end with 2 scenarios, "Cas 101: l'homme qui avait peur du noir", and "Cas 102: le prêtre qui avait peur des enfants", and a character sheet.

67471.name: No Quarter (Issue 3 - Nov 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Boatswain's Call - Letters to the Editor
Fire in the Hole - In the beginning there was Witchfire
Guts & Gears - Menoth Flameguard and Slayer Helljack
Modeling & Painting - Building and Painting the Thunderhead
The Pendrake Encounters - Death in the Marches, Part I
Toy Collector Alert! - Stryker Action Figure
67471.description:
From Publisher's website:

No Quarter #3 delves into the past of the Witchfire, looks at the 'jacks and troops for Superiority, and advice on picking your HORDES faction.

Cover Art "Center of Attention" by Matt Wilson

ISSN: 7558200192

67472.name: No Quarter (Issue 4 - Jan 2006)
rpgissuearticle: A Clean Escape & Catching the Train
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
67472.description:
From Publisher's website:
No Quarter #4 previews HORDES, dissects the Spriggan and Hammersmith warjacks, the lucrative business of cigars in the Iron Kingdoms, and a mini-adventure!

67473.name: No Quarter (Issue 5 - Mar 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Boatswain's Call - Letters to the Editor
Fire in the Hole - Paint like you've got a pair
Modeling & Painting - HORDES Faction Color Schemes
The Pendrake Encounters - Death in the Marches, Part III
67473.description:
From Publisher's website:

No Quarter #5 uncovers the secrets of the Orgoth, four WARMACHINE scearios, and a preview of the HORDES miniatures game.

Cover Art "Titan vs Trolls" by Brian Snoddy

ISSN: 7558200194

67474.name: Berserker
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67474.description:
User Summary:

Berserker introduces the "Third Force" into the In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas universe. The Third Force label designates occult forces independant of the forces of Good or Evil, such as beings from pre-christian pantheons. This sourcebook focuses on Vikings and Sorcerers.

Vikings are warriors who believe they have been recalled from Valhalla to take part in Ragnarok, the final battle between the Norse Gods and the Giants. They believe Demons to be the Giants, and Demons happily oblige (after all, viking warriors are less resilient than angels, and good target practice). The first chapters of the book contain everything needed to play a viking character, including character creation, powers, description of the pantheon, viking psychology and honor code...)

Sorcerers are human magicians, they seek knowledge and power by summoning angels or demons and attempting to bind them. Sorcerers are meant to be NPCs, but the rules cover everything needed to play one, including summon rules and some other spells.

The book ends with two scenarios: "Pour qui sonne le gland" is set during the battle for Berlin in 1945, the characters' goal is to eliminate Adolf Hitler. It can be played by angel, demon or viking player characters. "Qui veut la bite de Roger Rapeau" has the players (angels or demons) investigate a series of strange murders.

67475.name: Designing Divinities
67475.description:
User summary

Designing Divinities gives five explanations for divinity and enriches them with notes on how to incorporate them into the game, and with example plots.

While Designing Divinities mentions the d20 System, it is a generic product, usable with any fantasy RPG.

67476.name: Runes & Sigils
67476.description:
User summary

Runes & Sigils is a supplement to the sourcebook The Goy. It describes the role of families in the goy society. Families are presented as prestige feats, of which six different variants are included in the PDF file.

67477.description:
From the back of the box:

SEQUENCE + NUMBERS = FUN! The cards have the equations....the gameboard has the answers. Each card has an addition or subtraction equation. Match a card to its correct answer on the board, then place your chip there. Groups of numbers are color-coded to help with number recognition. When you have 5 of your chips in a row, you've got a SEQUENCE!
67477.name: Sequence Num6ers

67478.name: The Goy
67478.description:
User summary

The Goy introduces the demonic goy as a player and NPC race. It presents goy society, philosophy, culture, and psychology, along with goy classes, prestige classes, feats, and equipment.

67479.name: The Toad God's Treasure
67479.description:
User summary

The Toad God's Treasure is a dungeon crawl adventure that leads the characters into the ruined temple of the Toad God to prevent the destruction of the village of Feldspar.

The adventure is designed for four characters of 4th level.

67480.name: What's in a Name?
67480.description:
User summary

What's in a Name? is a supplement to the adventure The Toad God's Treasure. It includes a short piece of fiction, a discussion of the Toad God and his followers, and gives statistics for his servants, the Sculwugs.

67482.description:
In Go Goal! Ole! Tournament each player contols a team of five footballers. On their turn each players can spend up to one action for each footballer they control, not including the goalkeeper.

That action may be to move the footballer 1 space in any direction, to tackle another player, to pass the ball to another footballer or empty space, play an SFC (Special Function Card) or shoot for goal.

To tackle, each player rolls a D12. If the attacker wins, the two footballers exchange places and the attacker gains possession of the ball.

To pass the ball to another player or space, you just need to have line of sight to the space you're aiming for and it needs to be in a straight line (like the queen's movement in chess). You then simply place the ball on that player or space.

Each player recieves 3 Special Funcion Cards in each half of the game which can be played at any point during your turn.

To shoot at goal, each footballer figure has a spring-loaded knee joint which you pull back and release. This is where the dexterity aspect of the game comes in.

There are 90 of these super-quick turns in a standard game, and whoever has scored the most goals by the end is the winner.

From the description on the box:
Go Goal! Ole! Tournament is a five-a-side football board game, combining the technique of shooting a ball and strategic thinking of a board game that gives players to enjoy and feel the excitement of a real football match.

Contents:
1x Football Field
4x Footballs
8x Footballer Figures with Stands
2x Goalkeeper Figures with Stands
2x Goal Posts with 4x Goal Screws
1x Score and Round Counter
25x Special Function Cards
4x Promotion Stands
1x Coin
2x 12-sided Dice
4x Stoppage Cones
1x VCD/DVD Game Demo
1x Full-Colour Manual (in English)
4x Black & White Manuals (Danmark, Norge, Suomi & Sverige)

The official website is:
www.gogoalole.com
67482.name: Go Goal! Ole! Tournament

67483.name: Avengers: Masters of Evil
67483.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Action-packed adventures featuring your favorite heroes from the amazing Avengers Roster Book!

Including:
The TASKMASTER's New Academy of Crime!
The Rampaging ELEMENTS OF DOOM!
The Vile BARON ZEMO and TECHNO!
and those famous renegade heroes, The THUNDERBOLTS!

67484.name: Wolverine vs. The Brood Queen
67484.description:
An introductory adventure for the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game, released in a comic book format.

From the introductory paragraphs:
Welcome to the Marvel Universe, true believer!
You're clutching a free sample of the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game. With it, you can experience mighty Marvel action personally in a fight between Wolverine and a Brood Queen. You get to play Wolverine against this alien menace. You can do it alone, or let one of your friends play the Brood Queen against you. Afterward, you can trade parts and fight again!

67485.name: Captain America vs. Baron Zemo
67485.description:
An introductory adventure for the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game, released in a comic book format.

From the introductory text:
Welcome to the Marvel Universe, true believer!
You're clutching a free sample of the Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Game. With it, you can experience Marvel action personally in a fight between Captain America and Baron Zemo. You can play alone or let one of your friends play against you. Then you can trade parts and play again!

67486.name: Bubble Talk
67486.description: In the party game Bubble Talk, the active player each round presents one of 150 images included in the game to the other players; these players then each choose one of the caption cards in their hands, and the active player decides which caption fits the image best, awarding the image card to the player who submitted that caption. Bubble Talk includes 300 different caption cards, with the captions presented in word balloons, aka, "bubble talk".

67488.name: Too Bad!
67488.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Too Bad! is a perfect information game in which players want to be the first to bring all their dice home. Each player has dice that start with the face-up numbers 1-4, with the 4s in the starting spot farthest from home, the 3s in the next starting spot, and so on.

On a turn, a player moves one of her dice as many spaces as the sum of all the dice sharing the same space. Land on a "slip & flip" slide, and you knock off any dice in the middle of the slide, while flipping your die upside-down at the end of the ride. Thus, a 4 becomes a 3, a 3 becomes a 2, and so on.

67489.name: Prophecy: The Card Game
67489.description:
Publisher's website

The goal is to find prophecies and their matching fulfillments for six famous Prophets. When a match is made it scores a point for the player who made the prophecy. The first player to make three prophecies is the winner! Throughout the course of the game, Trials and Tribulations stir up trouble. Angels and Guardians may be able to help protect your Prophets from time to time, and Divine Interventions can help you as well.

67490.name: Kryształy Czasu (Book edition)
67490.description:
User Summary:

A Polish RPG published first through many issues of Magia i Miecz magazine, later as a softcover book, both by MAG publishing.
Every version of this item is really hard to get now, but there is much material collected by fans to download from the internet.

67491.name: Drugo: the ultimate drug education game
67491.description:
Each player has a card (similar to bingo) with drug "lifestyle" references
in each space, such as Cocaine, Police department, Illegal, Sedative, etc.
The caller has a stack of cards which he turns over one at a time and reads
the statement on it. Then players must determine what the proper response or
definition is, and place a token on that space.
A winner is determined when a card ihas every spot filled, and checked to be legal.
A variation for scoring is similar to bingo, with many variations, such as 4 corners,
5 in a row, 5 in a diagonal being a winner. There is also a master sheet
which the caller places the cards on when called, so that later when checking
a card, the person can figure out if they got a question wrong.

40 playing cards, 75 calling clues, Drugo Fact Sheet, Directions,
Checking Master Chart, Instruction sheet, and whole lot of pink
markers.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2011 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Nominee
2011 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Audience Award
2011 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Critic Award
67492.description:
Unfurl the banners of the Great Houses of Westeros! To secure power in the Seven Kingdoms and to ensure the survival of their lines, the Houses of Westeros each follow very different paths. Some forge strategic alliances, some create complex political intrigues, and still others use deceit and betrayal. But there is no more direct or lasting path to power than taking to the field of battle.

In Battles of Westeros, two players recreate the military conflicts set in George R.R. Martin’s A Song of Ice and Fire series, taking part in battles directly from the books... or designing their own. In this epic board game of battlefield tactics, players control either House Stark, the wards of Winterfell who have called their hearty allies to defend their honor and lands, or House Lannister, an aggressive force funded by Casterly Rock’s endless supply of gold.

Battles of Westeros is played over one of several included scenarios, called battles. Each of these has a battle plan that dictates the formation of the map (called the battlefield), starting positions of each House’s units, starting resources, special rules, and victory conditions for the game session. A battle is played over several rounds, with each round consisting of alternating player turns. The goals a player needs to accomplish to win a game of Battles of Westeros can vary (some battles require players to earn a certain number of victory points, while other battles require a player to take and hold strategic positions on the battlefield), but this collection of available scenarios, along with the ability to make your own exciting battles with the double-sided map board and over thirty map overlays, gives Battles of Westeros a wealth of replayability!

Battles of Westeros also offers plenty of strategic complexity, resulting in a satisfying number of compelling choices in every game. For example, each player has a special randomized Leadership Deck, consisting of unique tactics and abilities; this deck will change based on the scenario being played and characters present. Is Jaime Lannister on the battlefield? If you draw the appropriate Leadership Card, he can order nearby troops to aggressively rush their opponents! Is Eddard Stark guiding his forces into battle? Special flanking maneuvers enter your Leadership Deck, to potentially be drawn into your hand.

Battles of Westeros also features a level of realism that immerses you in the most significant conflicts of the War of the Five Kings. Each plastic figure base, which holds your infantry, archer, cavalry, and kennelmaster units, has a slot for a banner pole – a small flag-bearing attachment. The plastic banners that attach to each unit bear the crest of that unit’s house, and their orientation on the pole indicates at a glance whether that unit has been ordered yet. In addition to the intuitive and useful game effect this provides (differentiating the units you’ve activated from those you haven’t), the sight of your army’s banners spread impressively across the gorgeously designed game board will give you the sense that you are the clever Tywin Lannister, Lord of Casterly Rock... or the stoic Robb Stark, with his direwolf Grey Wind at his side!

67493.description:
From the publisher:

Cinderella, Ariel, Snow White, Aurora and Belle are racing to get ready and get to the Ball! Each Princess needs her invitation, her flowers, her crown, her dress and her shoes before she can go to the castle to meet her handsome Prince...

Players use a colored spinner to move their Princess along a colored path where some squares indicate one of the items the players are collecting. Items are represented by puzzle pieces that, when collected and assemble, form a picture of each of the 5 Disney Princesses in the game. When a player has collected all 5 items for their Princess and have reached the end of the path, they can meet up with their prince by getting the correct color on the spinner.
67493.name: Disney Princess Ready, Dress, Go!

67499.description: Schlafmütze is a card game of set collection, sly hand movements, and social observation for 3-7 players ages 5 and up. Players try to collect 4 matches of a drowsy character. The first player to do so subtly places the set down on the table in front of him. The other players, noticing this, place their own cards, matching or not, on the table. The last person with cards left in hand is the sleepyhead and must take the "sleeping goblin" token. Source: user summary
67499.name: Schlafmütze
